Margrate has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her husband’s business.  He wants to buy leather, thread and scissors, etc., which will help him do his job better and make more income.  Margrate is hopeful that the loan investment will make her husband’s business more profitable, which will result in a better standard of living for her family.  She is a new loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy leather, thread and scissors for shoe-repairing business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; la socia tiene 51 años de edad, casada y tiene 8 hijos; la socia se dedica a cuidar  un anciano de la tercera edad ,la socia se encarga de su alimentación y salud , la socia lleva un buen tiempo en este trabajo el cual le gusta ya que puede ayudar a una persona que lo necesita, la socia es una persona alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia, la socia necesita el préstamo ya que empieza el colegio y ella necesita para los útiles escolares de sus hijos y para sus matriculas.

La socia solicita el préstamo para su uso personal como son los utilies escolares de sus hijos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “CHASKA ÑAHUI” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is 51 years old, married and has 8 children.  She works caring for a senior citizen; she is in charge of his nutrition and health.  She’s been in this job for some time now and likes it because she can help someone who needs help.  She is a cheerful person with a strong drive to get ahead for her family.  She needs a loan because the school term is about to start and she needs it for her children’s school supplies and tuition.

She is asking for a personal use loan to buy her children’s school supplies.  She is happy with the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 30 años de edad, natural del distrito de Anco, es un  joven muy alegre y trabajador; convive con Zelmira de 24 años y tienen 02 hijos Yasmin de 05 años y Kelvin de 01 año de edad; juntos viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Santa Rosa anexo del distrito de Anco. La labor que realiza Jorge es labrar la tierra, donde tiene plantaciones de cacao y café. Sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra y gracias a ello, hoy trabaja en sus propias tierras. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo, donde lleva trabajando 10 años. En los días  de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de trasladar los productos cosechados hasta cierto tramo; para luego poder comercializarlo. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas están desarrollando, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; nos comenta además que la estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las lluvias son constantes así imposibilitando el rendimiento en su trabajo. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras y variar sus plantaciones, para así darle una buena estabilidad económica a  su  familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el crédito. Con los  2,000 nuevos soles solicitados,  comprará semillas de cacao y cítricos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 30, is from Anco district.  He is a cheerful, hard working young man.  He cohabits with Zelmira, 24, and they have two children, Yasmin, 5, and Kelvin, 1.  They all live together in their own house in the community of Santa Rosa, an annex of Anco district.

Jorge works as a farmer; he has cocoa bean and coffee crops.  His parents taught him how to till the land and thanks to that today he has his own fields.  He is well aware of how hard field work is; he’s been doing it for 10 years.  During harvest time he hires day laborers who transport the harvested products a certain distance to be sold.  He is very committed to his job because thanks to his daily efforts today he enjoys watching his plants develop thus earning good profits.  He also tells us that he doesn’t much enjoy the winter season because insects are plentiful and rain is constant making productive work impossible.  In time, he’d like to buy more land and vary his crops to provide his family with a good economic stability.

This is his first loan with MFP and he feels it will help his business’ progress a lot and is willing to repay in a timely fashion.  He thanks Prisma for granting the loan.  He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy cocoa bean and citrus seeds.

loans.use: To buy cocoa bean and citrus seeds.

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: El Sr. Moisés es casado, tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar y  tiene 40 años de edad,  actualmente asume el cargo de presidente  en la alcancía comunal “Unión por el Progreso” grupo  conformado por 7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Moisés trabaja desde hace 2 años como chofer en una Moto taxi propia, este trabajo surge a raíz de que lo despidieron en la empresa donde trabajaba, pero sus deseos de superación eran mas grandes que sus problemas y es así que hoy en día a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, que le ha permitido construir su casa, y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos . Sabemos que Moisés  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Moisés is married and has three school age children.  He’s 40 years old and is currently the President of the “Unión por el Progreso” (Unity for Progress) communal bank, a bank that has 7 members involved in various commercial activities.

Moisés has been working driving his own mototaxi for the past two years.  This job emerged when he lost the job he had in a firm where he used to work.  However, his desire to get ahead was greater than his problems and this is how today he has managed to improve his income which has led to his building his house and provide his family with a better quality of life.

With the aim to continue growing he has requested a new loan to cover the cost of his children’s school supplies.  We know that Moisés will meet his goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo loans will help him.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is single. She lives in Berdichev. Irina runs a clothing sales business in the central marketplace of her home town. She sells headgear, hose and other clothing items. Moreover, she sells pre-packed seeds, too. Irina is very friendly with customers and is always ready to offer the clients what they are looking for. Presently, she has 45,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her income is over 9,000 Grivnyas a month.    

Irina is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to open a new vending facility and stock it with clothing merchandise. She always tries to attract potential customers with quality merchandise so that they will trust her and come back for more shopping. This business is the main source of income for Irina. She is hoping to continue growing her business, opening additional vending locations in the future.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility and stock it with merchandise

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Plata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS DE PLATA” es un grupo que iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por nueve personas, ocho mujeres y un varón.

La asociación comunal “VICUÑITAS DE PLATA” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Erurita, como tesorera la señora  Grisel y en el cargo de secretario de actas el señor Santos.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción.  Entre esos negocios tenemos: venta de comida, chofer de transporte público, comerciante venta de varios, venta de Batidos (bebidas en bases a Bicervecina, azúcar y huevo), tejido a máquina, venta de comida, venta de ropa tejida, venta de comida para pollos, venta de queso.

En el caso de la señora Erurita, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que  actualmente tiene como negocio la venta de ropa tejida:   buzos para niño, polainas, y otros.  Estas prendas son elaboradas a máquina por ella misma, la señora Erurita trabaja en este rubro desde hace 36 meses. Ella realiza sus ventas por menor en diferentes ferias en la ciudad de El Alto, de manera ambulante.  Doña Erudita es una mujer joven y trabajadora de 25 años de edad, vive con su familia.   El crédito que ha solicitado será destinado para incrementar el capital de trabajo y comprar lana.
texts.en:
The “VICUÑITAS DE PLATA” (Little Silver Vicuñas) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Focal Center.  It has nine members: 8 women and one man.

The “VICUÑITAS DE PLATA” communal bank organized its governing board thus: Erurita is President, Grisel is Treasurer and Santos is Recording Secretary.  The businesses the members carry out are varied.  Some have to do with commerce, others with services and production.  Among the businesses we have: sale of food, public transportation driver, general merchandise sales, sale of “Batidos” [drinks based on Bi-Cervecina (low alcohol, dark, malt beer), sugar and egg], machine weaving, food sales, sale of knit clothes, sale of chicken feed and cheese sales.

In the case of Erurita, communal bank President, she indicates that she has a knit clothing sales business at present.  She sells children’s sweatshirts, leggings and others.  These items are machine woven by her.  She has been in this line of work for 36 months.  She makes her sales at various markets in the city of El Alto in an ambulatory way.

Erurita, 25, is a hard working, young woman living with her family.  She will use the requested loan to increase working capital and buy wool.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elaine; la socia tiene 36 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de repuestos de motos ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo llevan buen tiempo en este negocio a la vez la socia teje a mano y maquina chompas para damas, caballeros y niños ella trabaja a pedido desde su casa, la socia se siente feliz ya que mediante estas actividades la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas repuestos de motos y para comprar más lana para sus chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Ricchary Anteña Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Anta District within the Anta Province and the Department of Cusco.

Elaine is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling spare auto parts. She works with her husband and they have been in this business for quite some time. Elaine also knits women’s, men’s, and children’s sweaters by hand and using a machine. She works by request from her house and is happy because she gets her family ahead in life with these businesses.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of more spare auto parts and more wool for her sweaters.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To purchase more spare auto parts and more wool for her sweaters

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is one of our businesswomen and belongs to the group "Rayo D. Luz" 1 & 3, composed of 10 members. She works selling underwear for men and women. She makes her sales in her community which is a rural area surrounded by forests and mountains where citizen run their little farms in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural zone where some of her customers live and where other borrowers live.

Ana's family is composed of her child her long-term partner. Her most important challenge is to finishing her house. Her favorites activities are to take care of her child and her home. She has had her business for 3 years, starting with the first loan she took with us. Now she is receiving her 7th loan from Esperanza Internacional and, because her loan repayments have all been maD. punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the re-investment she makes from each loan.

She would like to save her profit to build a bathroom in her home. She also wants to proviD. food, clothing and housing expenses. She has a dream that one day not to far off, she will be able to live in a safer home with her family, and have her business on a settled footing.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Rosini

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosini; la socia tiene 40 años es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros ella tiene su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su casa esto le brinda la satisfacción de estar más tiempo con sus hijos, a la vez la socia vende helados de forma ambulatoria, ella compra y vende estos helados para luego distribuirlos a sus clientes.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas repuestos de carros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Ricchary Anteña Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Anta District within the Anta Province and the Department of Cusco.

Rosini is 40 years old, has a live-in partner, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling spare car parts. She runs her business from her house, which provides her with the satisfaction of spending more time with her children. Rosini also sells ice cream by foot. She buys and sells the ice cream to later distribute to her customers.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of more spare car parts.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To buy more spare car parts

loans.name: Milana

texts.en:
Milana is single. She lives in Uzhgorod. Milana sells textiles, towels and drapes. She started this enterprise 3 years ago. Currently, Milana has one vending location and her own clientele. She also boasts a wide assortment of inventory and a stable gross income of about 12,00 Grivnyas a month; her average monthly net profit equals 4,500 Grivnyas.  

Milana is requesting a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. She is very determined and hard-working, energetic and enterprising. She doesn’t want to stop at what she has achieved but strives to develop her business even further. Milana is hoping to use profits generated to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Nestor de 24 años natural del distrito de Anco, convive con Frida de 24 años y tienen 02 queridos hijos, Magaly de 08 años y Farid de 01 año de edad; juntos viven en su casa propia donde reina  la paz y la armonía. Nestor, es el sostén de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, es campesino y tiene 06 hectáreas de terreno donde viene trabajando 07 años en sus propias tierras. En su parcela cuenta con variedad de plantaciones como: hojas de coca,  plantas de café y plantaciones de cacao. Que son plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. En tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de la mano ajena y tiene que contratar jornaleros para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar más plantaciones de café. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el crédito. Con los  2,000 nuevos soles solicitados,  contratará peones para el desmonte de malezas.
texts.en:
Nestor, 24, is from Anco district.  He lives with Frida, 24, and they have two beloved children: Magaly, 8, and Farid, 1. They live together in their own house where peace and harmony reign.

Nestor is his family’s provider.  From a very early age his parents taught him how to work the fields.  He’s a farmer and has six hectares where he’s been growing his own crops for the last 7 years.  His parcel has the following crops: coca leaf, coffee plants and cocoa bean plants all of which are plants native to the Apurimac River Valley. 

During harvest season he needs extra help and must hire day laborers in order to pick the fruit.  What he most likes about his work is harvesting because that’s when he sees the months of hard work rewarded in the quality of his fruits.  He considers transporting his crops from the field to the city of San Francisco, which is where the best prices for them are available, to be the most difficult part of the job.  In the future he wants to buy new lands to increase his coffee production.

This is his first loan with MFP and he feels that this contribution will help him much in his work’s progress and is willing to repay in a timely fashion. He is grateful to Prisma for granting him the loan and will use the requested 2000 new soles to hire day laborers to clear weeds from his fields.

loans.use: To hire day laborers to help him remove weeds from his fields.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clorinda; la socia tiene 42 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende otro tipo de productos como gaseosas, golosinas, fideos, aceite entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio del cual se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca  su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank ” RICHARY ANTEÑA.” The bank is located in the Anta district belonging to the Anta province and the Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Clorinda, she is 42 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She alternates her activities with her grocery store business where she sells basic products like rice, sugar, and milk. She also sells other types of products such as soft drinks, candy, noodles, and oil, amongst others. She has had this business for years and is happy because through this business she is helping her family to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more merchandise for her business. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with her repayments.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is the resident of Faisalabad, which is a big city in Pakistan and famous for its textile industry. She has been living there in Ghafary town with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 10 years. Asia has 4 sons, all of them attending a local school.  Her husband’s name is S. J..  He operates a barber shop in the market. He offers good quality hair cutting and hair dressing services to his clients and manages a good client base. 

Asia, herself, is a house wife, who stays at home and takes care of her children and does her household chores. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who wants to buy scissors and hair products, like creams and gels, etc., for his barbershop. He will also buy some chairs and a sofa to increase the sitting arrangements for his clients. He has been doing this business for the past 3 years, and Asia is hopeful that the investment will be a productive one for him. 
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will bring positive financial changes to her family's financial life.

loans.use: To buy scissors, hair products, chairs and sofa for barber shop business

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; la socia tiene 40 años es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de restaurante ella brinda el servicio de almuerzo y cena la socia trabaja de lunes a sábado el restaurante se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa , la socia lleva años en este negocio del cual le trae muchas satisfacciones ya que le permite estar más tiempo con su familia esto es algo que le agrada bastante y desea continuar así la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas insumos como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maruja, 40, is a member of the “RICHARY ANTEÑA” communal bank located in Anta district which belongs to Anta province, Cusco department.

She has a spouse and four children.  She alternates her daily chores with running a restaurant; she cooks lunches and dinners, Monday through Saturday.  The restaurant is located in her home.  She’s been in business for years and it gives her much satisfaction because it allows her time to be with her family, something she enjoys very much.  She wants to continue like this.  She is a very cheerful person with much desire to get ahead.

She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like: rice, sugar, milk, noodles and oil, among others.

She is happy because of the loan and commits to repay her installments.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like: rice, sugar, milk, noodles and oil, among others.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin  M. tiene 28 años y vive en el barrio ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad de Barranquilla, muy cerca al escenario deportivo de futbol más importantes de Colombia. Allí tiene su negocio de venta de productos electrónicos, como parlantes,, consolas, bafles y repuestos para equipos de sonidos, negocio que inició después de haber terminado su carrera como analista y programador de computadores en el año 2010 y que inició en sociedad con su hermana.  Sus clientes  son los propietarios de grandes equipos de sonidos, o pickup, familias que adicionan a sus computadores accesorios para ampliar sus posibilidades  de velocidad en su equipo  y peatones del sector que identifican  elementos que Marvin vende y que  son satisfactores de sus necesidades. El  gran propósito de Marvin es ampliar el inventario de mercancías, para hacer acorde sus  ofertas de productos,  con la actualización que sus clientes requieren en el tema de tecnología  moderna. 
Con su negocio Marvin obtiene una rentabilidad del diez y siete por ciento y desde este margen proyecta su crecimiento, para generar posibilidades exitosa a su  familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 5 años.  Este es su primer financiamiento  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y  su primer credikiva, con él  planea comprar parlantes, consolas, bases para parlantes, repuestos para equipos de sonidos, al por mayor y de contado, lo cual pronostica una inversión exitosa, en la medida en que con esta compra obtendrá descuentos que trasladará a sus clientes, porque la satisfacción del cliente es su máxima.
texts.en:
Marvin M., 28, lives in Barranquilla’s 20 de Julio neighborhood, very near Colombia’s most important football stadium.  He has his business there selling electronic products like speakers, consoles, loudspeakers and sound system replacement parts, a business he started, in partnership with his sister, when he graduated as a Computer Analyst and Programmer in 2010.

His customers are owners of large sound systems, or pickups; families that add on to their computers components to expand speed, and passersby in the area that notice what things Marvin has for sale and decide that they meet their needs.  Marvin’s main goal is to expand his inventory of merchandise so that he can meet customer demand for upgrades to more modern technology.

Marvin’s profit margin in the business is 17% and he calculates improving from this point in order to provide his family, which consists of his wife and two children, who are 3 and 5 years of age, with successful possibilities.

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and his first Kiva loan.  He plans to use it to buy speakers, consoles, speaker stands and sound system replacement parts at wholesale and paying cash.  He foresees a successful investment because he will be able to get discounts to pass on to his customers because customer satisfaction is his motto.

loans.use: To buy speakers, consoles, speaker stands, sound system replacement parts at wholesale and for cash.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
Ana de 48 años, es una microempresaria que tiene un puesto de comidas.  Empezó con el negocio de comida desde hace años cuando vendía un plato típico del Ecuador “encebollado”. 
Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar sillas y mesas para su pequeño puesto de comida. Ahora ella tiene un puesto en el Guasmo, vende platos típicos del Ecuador, como arroz con pollo, arroz con menestra etc. 

Ella  quiere comprar con el préstamo plátanos, arroz y aceite para hacer mas comidas. En el futuro quiere conseguir contactos de empresas para vender almuerzos a empleados por pedido.
texts.en:
Ana, 48, is a small-businesswoman who has a post where she sells food.  She started in the food business a number of years ago when she used to sell a typical Ecuadorean dish called "encebollado" (fish stew with onions.)

Gradually, with a lot of effort, she was able to buy chairs and tables for her small food post.  Now she has a post in Guasmo, selling typical Ecuadorean dishes such as chicken and rice, rice stew, etc.

With this loan she wants to buy bananas, rice and cooking oil to make more food to sell.  In the future, she wants to make contacts with local businesses so she can sell lunches to the employees by order.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil and onions

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married with a daughter, Diana. She lives in the industrial city of Zaporozhye. Margarita runs a clothing sales business, selling socks, pantyhose and sportswear. She owns 7 vending locations in the central market called ‘Angolenko’. Margarita has been in the trade for 12 years. Her gross income amounts to 60,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Margarita is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to pay customs clearance fees. Margarita purchases inventory wholesale in China for further re-sale in Ukraine. She then needs to import her merchandise into the country. Customs fees are high, and Margarita decided to request a loan to cover these costs. One of her future plans is to continue growing her enterprise, adding more vending facilities to the ones she already has.

loans.use: To pay customs clearance fee

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora, es una mujer muy bondadosa y noble, de 65 años. Tiene 4 hijos, el mayor vive con su papa en el extranjero. Ella, vive con los tres últimos ya independientes en su casa propia. Desde muy joven trabajó de manera informal en la venta de frutas, en busca de un bienestar para sus hijos, ya que el sueldo de su esposo no es suficiente. Era ya muy conocida en su puesto, pero a veces sufría  por el desalojo de los policías municipales  por ser vendedora informal y, eso le hacia perder sus ventas. Por ello poco a poco buscó y encontró asociarse en un mercado de frutas, desde entonces trabaja más segura durante 15 años, y con estas ganancias educó a sus hijos que ahora son profesionales. En la actualidad su negocio es mucho mas dinámico, ya que los proveedores van a su puesto y le dejan de 300  a 400 cajas de naranjas ó mandarinas de acorde a la temporada, por ello Flora trabaja con la ayuda de su sobrina para agilizar sus ventas. Para ella, su negocio es terapéutico, ya que se siente feliz y  ocupada atendiendo a sus clientes, y piensa, que mas adelante, continuará ampliando su negocio. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudarles, ya que  este aporte le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca de su progreso. Flora, cada dos días se abastece de más frutas para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, incrementará más cajas de frutas, de esa manera podrá abastecer de mercadería y cumplir con la demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Flora, 65, is a very noble, generous woman.  She has four children; her oldest son lives abroad with his father.  She lives with her other three, already independent, children in her own house.  

Since she was very young she’s been working in informal fruit sales seeking wellbeing for her children since her husband’s salary is insufficient.  She was very well known in her stand but sometimes she suffered when the municipal police would evict her for being an informal seller causing her to lose sales.  Because of this, she gradually found a way to become associated with a fruit market and since then she’s been working more securely for the last 15 years and the profits made it possible for her to educate her children who are now professionals.

Her business now is much more dynamic because suppliers come to her stand and leave 300-400 cases of oranges or mandarins according to the season.  Because of this Flora works with help from her niece to speed up sales.  For her, the business is therapeutic because she feels happy and occupied taking care of customers and thinks that later on she’ll continue expanding it.

This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she promises to pay her installments punctually because she does not want to disappoint them because this contribution will allow her to continue working seeking progress.

Flora stocks up of fruit every two days so will use the requested loan to increase the number of crates of fruit to stock up on merchandise and meet the demand she has.

loans.use: To buy more crates of fruit to stock her business.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La sra. Alicia del Carmen Z. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de ropa interior nueva, tiene dos años de realizar dicha actividad.
Doña Alicia realiza sus ventas de forma ambulante en diferentes fábricas de puros de esta ciudad, al igual que en oficinas públicas, la mayor parte de estas ventas las realiza al crédito por lo que deja un día a la semana para cobrar.
Doña Alicia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, esto es debido a la facilidad de pagos que ofrece a sus clientes, la amabilidad con la que los atiende y que lleva el producto hasta donde se encuentran los clientes.
Es notable que doña Alicia a sabido administrar su negocio y sus condiciones de vida son muy favorables.
Doña Alicia es madre soltera de una hija, la cual es maestra de educación primaria,  esto gracias al apoyo que doña Alicia le brindo en el trascurso de sus estudios, hoy su hija es una persona de bien para la sociedad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia del Carmen Z. is a merchant selling new underwear.  She’s been in business two years.

Alicia sells going from cigar factory to cigar factory in this city as well as to public offices.  Most of her sales are on credit so the dedicates one day a week for payment collection.

Alicia has quite a few customers thanks to the easy payment plans she offers, the kindness with which she takes care of them and because she takes the items to them wherever they are.

It is noteworthy that Alicia has known how to run her business and her living conditions are very favorable.

Alicia is a single mother.  Her daughter is an elementary school teacher thanks to the support her mother provided throughout her schooling.  Today, her daughter is a person who benefits society.

She will use the loan to buy underwear.

loans.use: To buy women's and men's underwear.

loans.name: Kenia

texts.en:
Kenia is one of our businesswomen. She has been selling underwear for approximately two years, after she received her first loan and she runs other business activities. Now on her 8th loan, she is investing in more underwear and other clothing. Her last three loans have been used to improve this business activity. She is a wholesale seller. 

Kenia’s family consists of her child and her long-term partner. They are a young family, with a lot of goals.  Her next challenge is to have her own house and to have an improved business. Her dreams include finishing her house and having a large business. At the moment, she will be reinvesting her business profits to expand her business in inventory and customers.

loans.use: to buy  underwear to sell wholesale

loans.name: Marcos Aurelio

texts.es:
Marcos Aurelio reside en colinas del sur municipio de diriamba, tiene 56 años vive con su esposa y tres hijos mayores de edad. Marcos tiene una moto taxi, con la que trabaja realizando viajes a personas que transitan por el centro de y que desean desplazarse a otra zona, trabaja todos los días desde hace 6 años.
Él necesita un préstamo para mejorar su moto taxi. Sus aspiraciones son continuar mejorando su vivienda, hacerla cada vez más confortable y segura, también cuidar su trabajo porque de él depende su familia y la realización de estos proyectos.
texts.en:
Marcos Aurelio lives in Diriamba’s Colinas del Sur neighborhood.  He is 56 years old living with his wife and three adult children.  Marcos has a mototaxi that he uses to provide transportation for people wanting to go from downtown to other zones.  He works every day and has been in business six years.

He needs a loan to improve his mototaxi.  His wish is to continue improving his home making it more comfortable and secure each time as well as looking after his job because his family and the completion of these projects depend on it.

loans.use: For mototaxi repair.

loans.name: Lucila Esperanza

texts.es:
La sra Lucila Esperanza D. se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, cuenta con mas de seis (6) años de experiencia en venta de ropa.
doña Lucila vende su producto de manera ambulante en diferentes zonas de la ciudad de Danli, la mayor parte de estas ventas las realiza al crédito por lo que cuenta con una gran clientela ya que algunas personas que no pueden comprar de contado ella les da la facilidad de pago.
Doña Lucila convive en unión libre y juntos han procreado dos hijos que en la actualidad ambos están cursando sus estudios secundarios en un colegio de esta ciudad.
el creedito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, desea tener mas variedad de ropa y asi tener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila Esperanza D. sells new clothing. She has more than six (6) years of experience selling clothing. Lucila sells her products as a street vendor in different areas of the city of Danli. She sells most of them on credit and therefore she has a lot of customers. Some people can't pay for it up front and she facilitates payment. 

Lucila is in a common law marriage and toegther they have two children who at present go to high school in town. She will use the loan to buy clothing. She wants to have a wider variety of clothing and thus have more earnings, which she needs to get her family ahead.

loans.use: To buy jeans, shirts, blouses, and underwear.

loans.name: Maggi

texts.es: Maggi  Baoque con su nuevo credikiva, que es el cuarto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  y el segundo con KIVA,   continuará invirtiéndole al mejoramiento de su local, porque cada día su clientela crece y ella está dispuesta a lograr   un sitio muy confortable para ellos, así es que ella  está posicionadose en su mercado,  pues además agrega valor a su trabajo porque estudia pedagogía y eso mismo aplica a sus clientes, que la reconocen por su gran vocación de servicio y de enseñanza ala comunidad. Su  sueño  y gran desafío es construír su segunda planta para separar totalmente su negocio de su espacio familiar. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Maggi ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/173221
texts.en:
Maggi Baoque will use her new Kiva loan, which is her fourth with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and second with Kiva, to continue investing in improving her locale because her customer base is growing daily and she wants to accomplish having a very comfortable place for them.  She is positioning herself in the marketplace adding value to her work because she’s studying Teaching and she applies her knowledge to her customers who recognize her vocation for service and for teaching the community.

Her great dream and challenge is to build a second story to totally separate the business from her living quarters.  

If you’d like to know Maggi’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/173221

loans.use: For physical improvements in her Internet access business.

loans.name: Dorian Orquidea

texts.es:
Doña Dorian  F. es comerciante y su actividad es la venta de cosméticos, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Doña Dorian vende su producto de manera ambulante en diferentes partes de esta ciudad como ser: fabricas de puros y oficinas gubernamentales. sus productos los vende al credito. sus clientes las prefieren debido a la amabilidad con la que ella atiende y por la calidad del producto que vende.
Doña Dorian convive en unión libre y con su compañero de hogar han procreado a dos hermosas niñas, una de ellas tiene meses de edad y la mayor actualmente esta en Pre-kinder, nos comentaba doña Dorian que sus dos hijas son las que la animan a seguir adelante y asi ofrecerles un buen futuro.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos al por mayor para obtener mayores ganancias en las ventas.
texts.en:
Mrs.Dorian F. is a merchant and her activity is selling cosmetics. She has been doing this activity for 3 years.

Dorian sells her products as a vendor in different parts of the city, for example in cigar factories and government offices. She sells her products on credit. Her customers prefer her because of the friendliness she serves them with and the quality of the products she sells. 

Dorian is in a common law marriage and she and her husband have two beautiful daughters together. One of them is only months old and the oldest is in pre-school at this time. Dorian told us that her two daughters are what encourages her to get ahead to offer them a good future.  

She will use the loan to buy cosmetics wholesale to obtain more earnings with the sales.

loans.use: To buy creams, deodorants, lotions, baby oil, talcum powders, perfumes, lipsticks, nail polish and t-shirts.

loans.name: Arasa Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Arasa Poty se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la compañía de Hugua Rey, Distrito de Santaní.
El comité Arasa Poty está en el 5to. Ciclo con 12 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución.
La sra. Salmi es la presidenta del comité, ella posee una tienda general donde trabaja con algunas de sus compañeras, ellas desean poder aumentar su lista de mercaderías o productos a ofertar, por ello necesitan el crédito, ya que por recursos propios todavían están incapaces de lograrlo.
Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
The Arasa Poty committee was formed when several neighbors from Hugua Rey, Santini district, joined together.

The Arasa Poty committee is in its 5th cycle with 12 members.  It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, mutually supportive and responsible.  The members have a great enterprising spirit since they are up to date with their payments and intend to finish this stage with very good results respecting responsibility toward the institution.

Salmi is the committee President.  She has a general store where she works with some of her fellow members.  They want to increase the list of stock items or products they offer so they need a loan because their own resources are still insufficient to do so.  Getting the loan opens many doors for their enterprises’ progress.

loans.use: To buy clothing, fruit, vegetables and nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 61 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 6 años que posee una tienda en el interior D. su casa, ya que en años anteriores lo tenía en otro lugar, pero el alquilar no le era muy rentable. Hoy su tienda esta implementada D. diversos productos, que necesarios para sus clientes, permitiéndole así captar más clientela y sus ganancias aumentar. Por otro lado, esta laboriosa mujer se dedica a la agricultura, y D. los productos que cosecha lo venD. en su tienda, así es como se gana la vida y ahora con mayor prioridad necesita implementar su tienda con más productos. Es su  séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda en gaseosas, productos comestibles, y cerveza.
texts.en:
Susana, 61, lives with her husband in her own house.  She’s had a store in her house for over six years because years ago she had it in another place but rent was not affordable.  Today, her store is stocked with various products that are needed by her customers allowing her to capture more customers and increase profits.

On the other hand, this hard working woman also farms and she sells what she harvests in her store.  This is how she earns a living so her priority to stock her store now is even higher.

This is her 7th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she’s always been responsible with her payments. Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.  She thanks all those who will fund the loan that will be so useful for her business’ progress.  

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise for her store like soft drinks, food items and beer.

loans.use: To buy more stock food items for her store.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Faisalabad, which is Pakistan’s third largest city and known for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Samanabad. She moved here 25 years ago.  She is 48 years old, married to R. M., and has 3 sons. Due to financial constraints, her 2 elder sons left their education and started work. With the older sons' financial support, Razia has been able to send her youngest son to school.   He is in the 10th grade. Her husband has a private job, and Razia supports him financially by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. She has been doing this work for the past 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is old and doesn’t produce  quality work. With the new machine, she will be able to complete sewing orders on time and will be able to accept more orders every month. She hopes that this investment will bring positive changes to her business and her monthly income will grow.  She is a new loan user of Asasah, and this is her first loan application. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Razia”.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Milagro

texts.en:
Milagros’s family consists of her 6 children, but just five of them live together with her and their father. They are a big family, with older and younger members, some of them bringing in income to the household and others attending school.  Milagros's family goals are to have a big house where all her children can live comfortably and succeed . Milagros also wants to finish her own studies and to have a locale for her business. She will be using her profit toward this goal.

Milagros is one of our businesswomen. She operates a business producing and selling cassava bread and turnovers ("empanada", a small round of cassava flour, filled with meat and fried). She presently sells them by her home, that's why she wants to have a locale. She will invest in a machine for grinding cassava. She has more clients and she wants to expedite the process. After she has been running her business, she feels more comfortable with her income and expenses.

loans.use: to buy a machine for grinding cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For tables, chairs and food.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Mario Jose tiene un negocio que es la venta y elaboración de repostería. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio. Este negocio lo aprendió como un tipo de trabajo que le genere ganancias para mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de harina, mantequilla, huevos entre otros productos. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Sueña con es establecer otro negocio de repostería.
texts.en:
Mario José makes pastry to sell.  He’s been in business over 11 years.  He learned the business as a way to generate funds to support his two children that are in his care.

He will use the loan to buy flour, butter and eggs, among other products.

This activity is his main source of income for support.  He dreams with setting up another pastry business.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and eggs, among other products.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Manuel (35); que es obrero, y su pequeña hija; juntos buscan progresar cada día. 

Desde hace cinco  años esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, y tiene clientes que le compran seguido, pues además de ofrecer con su catalogo,  también ofrece en su vitrina instalada en su casa. Le gusta mucho este negocio pues es tranquilo y puede cuidar a su hija sin problemas, además no solo recibe ganancias por sus ventas si no también por la cantidad de pedidos recibe incentivos de la compañía, pues la premian con electrodomésticos que puede utilizar o vender. Así transcurren los días de Dina que además prepara chupetes de hielo y chicha (refresco de maíz morado) durante la época veraniega, que vende en su casa. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y surtir otra vitrina. 

Dina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de variedad de mercadería en productos de belleza pues quiere surtir mejor su negocio para mejorar sus ganancias. 

Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Dina, 37, lives in her house with her husband, Manuel, 35, who is a laborer, and their small daughter; together they seek to make progress every day.

Five years ago this enterprising woman went into business selling beauty products of a well known brand.  She has customers that buy from her often because besides offering items via catalogue she also has a display case set up at home.  She likes the business very much because it’s calm and she can care for her daughter problem free.  Besides, she doesn’t just earn profits through sales but the firm also offers incentives depending on the number of orders she places; they reward her with home appliances that she can either use herself or sell.

Dina’s days go by this way although during the summer she also prepares “chupetes” which are made from ice and chicha (a beverage made from purple corn) that she sells from home.  Because she’s an enterprising woman she’s planning to expand her beauty products sales business in the future installing a second, stocked display case.

Dina plans to use the requested funds to buy a selection of beauty product merchandise to better stock her business to improve profits.

This is her ninth loan with MFP and she promises to pay her installments punctually because she does not want to disappoint the people who made the money, which will allow her to stay in business seeking progress, possible.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumaila is an educated lady who got her education up to the 12th grade.  After that, her parents had her married to S. N., who works in a private company for a reasonable income. She has a daughter who is studying in 10th grade. 

Shumaila started a sewing business 5 years ago to financially assist her husband. She takes orders from her neighborhood clients and fulfills the orders at a given time to earn profits. The income generated helps her to pay the school fees of her daughter and to pay the utility bills.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her sewing business. She will use the loan money to buy a new sewing machine, which will allow her to complete the orders early and make larger profits.  Her old machine doesn’t produce quality work and takes much time to sew a single dress.  Shumaila is hopeful that, after buying a new sewing machine, she will be able to get improved profits, which will result in bettering the financial life of her family. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that it will be a good step for a better financial future.  Shumaila lives in an industrial city of Pakistan, known as Faisalabad. She owns a 2-room house there in the area of Samanabad. She moved there after her marriage 17 years ago.

Note: "In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Shumaila".

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de  capitalizar su actividad y otras para emprender actividades productivas, les resultaron muy fructíferas  e interesantes por los beneficios brindados por el programa.
El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Katupyry, actualmente se encuentran en el décimo quinto ciclo; en el ciclo anterior tropezaron con inconvenientes debido a que dos integrantes no cuplieron a cabalidad con el pago de sus cuotas pero con el esfuerzo de todas lograron recuperarse, el grupo está  integrada por 15 emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y brindarles lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. Todas las integrantes son luchadoras y han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
La sra. Gladys, la presidenta del comité, cada día sale a la madrugada de su casa para poder vender sus frutas a las amas casas, antes de que estas decidan ir al mercado, ella se acerca casa por casa, desea por ello poseer su pequeño puesto de venta, ya que todos la conocen por la buena calidad de sus productos. Necesita el crédito para comprar más frutas, a fin de venderlos y aumentar sus ingresos para realizar su meta.
texts.en:
In Paraguarí, women meet with the goal of capitalizing their businesses and undertaking productive business ventures. The result has been very fruitful and interesting due to the benefits brought on by the program. The group goes by the name Kuña Katupyry and is currently in its 5th cycle. In the previous cycle, the group ran into problems because two of its members did not fulfill their loan payments. However, with much effort they all managed to recover. The group is made up of 15 enterprising women who do their best to increase their incomes and to provide the best for their respective families. All the women are hard workers and have invested their loans in their individual businesses.

Gladys is the president of the group. Every day she leaves her house at dawn in order to sell fruit to housewives before they decide to go to the store. She goes house to house and wants to own her own stand because everyone knows her for the high quality of her products. She needs the loan to buy more fruit to sell so she can increase her income and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits

loans.name: Betty Judith

texts.es:
Betty de 53 años de edad vive con su cónyuge e el barrio La Magdalena; ella  tiene un negocio de peluquería, donde también vende  a sus clientes productos capilares entre otros que resaltan la belleza e imagen femenina y masculina. Es te es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer credikiva, el cual invertirá en la compra de productos de tocador y de aseo personal  e insumos de peluquería, que necesita para hacer sus tratamientos de belleza, como alicer, champoo y rince al por mayor y de contado, asegurando una inversión exitosa por los descuentos en mayor cantidad y un precio moderado para sus clientes.  Su negocio lo inició hace diez años y funciona desde entonces  en la casa de sus padres, allí  Betty presta el servicio de cortes de cabellos, alicer, pedicure, manicure y vende mercancías asociadas al realce de la imagen personal y profesional de sus clientes, como gel para la piel, pintauñas, cosméticos etc.
Su sueño es tener una distribuidora de productos capilares y de belleza en general, ademá de  una academia donde instruir a estudiantes con las técnicas que ella conoce perfectamente y que desea transmitir a muchas generaciones, para que conviertan este conocimiento en un negocio generador de ingreso y empleo permanente. Su mayor desafío es tener una vivienda propia  para ubicar su microempresa de una manera confortable, por eso se esmera todos los días en trabajar arduamente para lograr ahorros que se lo permitan.
texts.en:
Betty is 53 years old and lives with her partner in La Magdalena neighborhood.  She has a hairdressing business where she also sells her customers hair products and other products that highlight their male and female beauty and image.  This is Betty's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first Kiva loan.  She will invest it in buying beauty and personal care products and hairdressing supplies that she needs for her beauty treatments such as hair straightener, shampoo and rinse.  She will make these purchases wholesale and pay cash.  This will be a successful investment as she will receive discounts for buying in large quantities.  This will help keep prices reasonable for her customers.  Betty started her business ten years ago and she runs it from her parents' home.  There she provides her customers with hair cuts, hair straightening, pedicures and manicures.  She also sells related merchandise for her customers' personal and professional image such as skin cream, nail polish, cosmetics, etc. 

Betty's dream is to own a hair and beauty product wholesalers as well as an academy where she can teach students the techniques that she knows so well and that she would like to hand down to other generations so that they can turn this knowledge into a business that makes them income and permanent work.  Betty's biggest challenge is having her own home where she can comfortably locate her small business.  For this reason, she takes care every day to work hard in order to make the savings she needs to achieve this.

loans.use: To buy beauty and personal care products as well as hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 25 años se dedica cultivar alfalfa en sus propios terrenos de cultivo y las vende  al por mayor a sus clientes que son comerciantes de alfalfa, la ventaja que tiene de su negocio es que sus terrenos son de su propiedad que le permite mayores márgenes de ganancia, de esta manera puede solventar la economía de su hogar. Su esposo  trabaja junto con ella en sus terrenos desde las primeras horas de la mañana para cortar la alfalfa y repartir a su clientela. Durante estos años ha visto el crecimiento de su negocio que ha decidió seguir mejorando sus cultivos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta y motivada de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in her own home.  For over 25 years she has been growing alfalfa on her own farmland. She sells the crop wholesale to alfalfa merchants.  The advantage she has is that she owns the land and therefore has a higher profit margin allowing her to cover household expenses.

Her husband works alongside her from the early morning on harvesting the alfalfa and delivering it to customers.  Over the years she has seen her business grow and so has decided to improve her crop.  This is her first loan through MFP.  She is excited and motivated knowing she has this financial support.  She is grateful to all the lenders who are contributing to her progress.  She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Chamampi Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHAMAMPI SARTSIÑANI” (en idioma aymara: “con fuerza nos levantaremos”) es un grupo que iniciará el ciclo número dos en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesto por ocho personas.  

La asociación comunal “CHAMAMPI SARTSIÑANI” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Ana Maria, también se encuentra como tesorera la señora  Cipriana y como secretaria de actas la señora Fabiola.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción.  Entre esos negocios tenemos: artesanía (confección de chompas), venta de golosinas, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, salón de belleza, punto de Telefonía pública, comerciante de macramé.

En el caso de la señora Ana María, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que  actualmente tiene como negocio la venta de golosinas en un puesto cerca de la Escuela “Adrian Castillo”,  compra la mercadería de “la tablada”, calle en la que venden estos productos por mayor, ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz.   Comenzó el negocio con Bs. 800.- y ahora su solicitud es por Bs. 2000.-, este dinero también será invertido en la compra de dulces, chocolates, galletas, y otros.  Por ahora trabaja sola, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
The “CHAMAMPI SARSIÑANI” (Aymara for “with strength we will rise”) group will be starting its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Focal Center; it has 8 members.

The “CHAMAMPI SARSIÑANI” communal bank organized its governing body thus: Ana María is President, Cipriana is Treasurer and Fabiola is Recording Secretary.  The businesses the members of this communal bank are in are varied.  They are involved in commerce, services and production.  Among them we have: crafts (sweater making), sweets sales, clothing sales, neighborhood store, beauty salon, telephone call center, macramé merchant.

Ana María, communal bank President, currently has a business selling sweets in a stand near the “Adrian Castillo” School.  She buys the merchandise in “La Tablada” a street located in the city of La Paz where these products are sold at wholesale.  She started the business with Bs. 800 and now she’s asking for Bs. 2000 to buy candy, chocolates, cookies and others.  For now, she works by herself.  She lives with her spouse and two children.

loans.use: To buy candy, chocolates, cookies and others.

loans.name: Flor De Mayo Group

texts.es: Doña Fidelina Angelica S. I., es casada, tiene 28 años de dad, cursos el sexto grado de primaria escolar, tiene 4 hijos 3 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la elaboracion de almohadas, tiene 5 años de experiencia con este oficio, empezo cuando tenia 18 años de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante. doña Fidelia reune a otra compañeras para organizar grupo y solicitar un prestamo a ASDIR, que les servira para ampliar su capital de trabajo,las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas que son: crianza de animales, vebnta de plasticos y venta de ropa. Doña Fidelia quiere ver que su negocio se grande.
texts.en:
Doña Fidelina Angelica S. I., 28, is married and studied up to the sixth grade in school.  She has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school, and earns a living making pillows.  She has five years of experience in this work having started when she was 18 years old.  She relies on her husband's support who is merchant.  

Doña Fidelia gathered some friends to organize a group and solicit a loan from ASDIR which will serve to increase their working capital.  The members of this group work in diverse areas like: raising small animals, selling plastics, and selling clothing.  Doña Fidelia wants to see her business grow big.

loans.use: Working captial.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a special loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. She lives in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and one child. 

Maria is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her bakery by purchasing flour, sugar, eggs, cake molds, gas and other items. She makes good cakes and candies. She has had her business for 5 years, after she received her first loan of $50 US. She enjoys serving customers and taking care of her child. Her future plan is to become a successful businesswoman. She will use the profit to save. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cake molds, utensils, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a resident of Samanabad, which is a small housing colony located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and well known for its textile industry. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 15 years. She is the mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. Unfortunately, none of them was able to get an education due to financial constraints. 

A talented lady, Lubna owns & operates a sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She learned this art from her mother before her marriage and is now taking good advantage of it.  She sews clothes for her neighborhood clients and earns income after completing orders on time. Her clients prefer getting service from her, due to her good quality work and reasonable charges. 

Lubna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is old and doesn’t produce quality work. She has good expectations that she will be able to expand her sewing business because she will be able to finish the orders in a shorter time.   That will allow her to take more orders every month. 
She is a new loan user of Asasah and is confident that it will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a resident of a city called Faisalabad which is known in Pakistan for its textile industry. She owns a four-room house there and has been living in it with her family for the past 22 years. 

Parveen and her husband E. are very hard-working people. They are involved in a dairy business. For this purpose, they keep a buffalo at their home which produces about 8 to 10kg milk every day. E. transfers the milk to the milk pots and sells it to different community people by delivering it to their homes on his motorbike. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for their dairy business. With the loan, they will buy another buffalo which will increase the milk productivity and help them to sell more and to earn better profits. Perveen is hopeful that her family business will improve after making a loan investment in it. This will not only make an asset (the buffalo) but also increase their income. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Ko'eju Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de emprender actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinaron la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
El comité lleva por nombre Ko'eju, se ha caracterizado por la unidad, su dinamismo y respeto mutuo, de quienes por medio de este emprendimiento fortalecerían el lazo entre ellas, actualmente se encuentran en el décimo quinto  ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 12 emprendedoras señoras.
La sra. Nora, una de las integrantes, desea el crédito para comprar cerdos, ya que ella se dedica a la cría de cerdos y de ellos quita la grasa que necesita para hacer otros alimentos, o bien los vende luego a las empresas o cooperativas que realizan embutidos.
texts.en:
A group of women from the city of Paraguarí joined together to initiate productive activities.  They coordinated a meeting to learn about the Mujeres Emprendedoras program.

The committee is called Ko’eju and is characterized by the unity, dynamism and mutual respect of those who through this means have strengthened the bond between them.  They are currently in their 15th cycle with a grade of ‘excellent.’   It is composed of 12 members.

Nora is one of the members.  She wants the loan to buy pigs because she raises pigs.  She removes the fat from them to make other foods or sells them to firms or cooperatives that manufacture cured meats.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Duo Getzemani De Sacatepequez Group

texts.es:
Duo Getzemani de Sacatepequez: es integrante por doña Felipa T., Soltera pero hace 14 años su vida cambio cuando le regalaron una nena convirtiendola en madre soltera, teniendo asi la compania y ayuda de su niña, quien tambien la ayuda a la venta de ropa tipica de su comunidad de donde ella es originaria ella tambien se dedica a la venta de tejidos y servilletas.
Doña Agustina Quien teje servilletas tipicas desde muy pequeña manifiesta que son muy vendibles en la localidad y fuera, dice tener la ayuda de sus 4 hijas que al regresar de la escuela la ayudan en este oficio con la que ella colabora al sosten y educacion de sus hijos.
Las dos expresan lo dificil que es la vida economicamente para ellas y su familia pero sus hijos son las que les motivan diariamente, quieren brindarle educacion a sus hijos para que ellos en un futuro no pasen lo que ellas han vivido, pero a Dios gracias tienen salud y ganas de luchar diariamente, las dos solicitan el credito para la compra de hilo para comfeccion de tejidos.
texts.en:
Getzemani de Sacatepequez Duo: 

Mrs. Felipa T. is single but 14 years ago her life changed when she was given a baby girl turning her into a single mother.  She now has the companionship and help of her daughter who also helps her sell clothing typical of the community she’s from.  She also sells weavings and napkins.

Agustina has woven typical napkins since she was very little.  She states that they are quite salable in her location and in other locations.  She has four daughters that help her when then come home from school.  This works allows her to help with her children’s support and education.

Both of them state how difficult life is for them and their families economically.  However, their children motivate them daily.  They want to provide their children with education so that they will have better futures and not go through what they’ve had to endure.  Thanks to God, though, they have their health and the drive to work every day.

Both are asking for funds to buy thread to make their weavings.

loans.use: To buy thread to make weavings.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the eastern part of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. Felix's community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity.

Felix requires a loan to buy diverse inventory of fruit (such as oranges, papayas, pineapples, bananas, watermelons, grapefruit, etc.)  to sell wholesale to others in the public market. He will be starting this business. This is his first loan with field partner Esperanza International, and he decided to take out a loan with us because he feel comfortable with the payments and especially because these loans are for businesses. He is very excited about taking out this loan. He will make a step toward having one of his dreams come true, the one about having his own business, and he knows that by working hard, he will improve his business and with the benefits he will be able to help his family and to pay university fees for his children.

Felix says that his favorite thing is to serve, and he hopes that some of the profit from his business will be saved to buy his own vehicle and to have an improved business without debts.

loans.use: to buy oranges, papayas, pineapples, bananas, watermelons, grapefruit, etc.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní en el Asentamiento Santa Rosa. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas de comestibles.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Este comité está empezando con el primer ciclo, con muchas ganas de sobresalir adelante con este grupo.
La sra. Maria Paulina es la presidenta del comité y ella posee una despensa en su domicilio donde provee de comestibles a todos sus vecinos, pero necesita cargar más productos a su despensa para poder cubrir mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Por ello solicita el crédito, para poder adquirirlo.
texts.en: “La Esperanza” [Hope] Group was formed by several neighbors from the city of Santaní in the Santa Rosa district. All the members of the group carry out independent business activities, such as food sales. The members form a tight-knit group capable of working together to strengthen their camaraderie. This group is starting their first loan cycle, and is looking forward to improving their lives through the group. Maria Paulina is the group's president and she has a grocery store in her house where she provides consumable goods to all her neighbors, but she needs to get more products for her store so she can better meet the needs of her customers. She is requesting the loan in order to obtain them.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, fruits, bread products, and consumable goods in general.

loans.name: Hajra's Group

texts.en:
Hajra is 45 years old. Her husband’s name is N. A. and he has a construction supply sales business. He sells supplies to different construction companies and to the regular customers at a good profit.  

Hajra shares the financial burden with her husband by selling shawls (item of clothing, loosely worn over the shoulders). She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and completes their orders by providing them shawls of different qualities. She purchases these shawls from the city of Lahore where she visits once a month.  

She has three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son makes shoes. He learnt this art from a person in his community. He worked with him for three years and now he operates his own business. Her first two daughters help her in operating her shawl-selling business. Others are studying, attending a local school.  

Hajra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy leather, nails and shoe polish to make shoes in larger quantity. Hajra is very confident that her son’s 5 years of experience in his business will help him earn better profits after the loan investment and she will be able to save some of the profit to marry off her daughter in the near future.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be profitable experience for her.  

She lives in Kasur which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, famous for its leather industry. She lives there in a small home which contains two rooms, in the area of Jamatpura.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails and shoe polish for shoe-making business

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité La Amistad se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la compañía de Hugua Rey, Distrito de Santaní.
El comité está en el quinto ciclo con 12 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad. Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus emprendimientos.
La presidenta del grupo, Liss Mabel, es una criadora de pollitos, que luego vende para poner huevos o para las pollerías, pero como ultimamente están subiendo de precio en el mercado de ofertas los pollitos, desea el préstamo para poder seguir con su negocio, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos económicos que posee.
texts.en:
The La Amistad group was formed by several neighbors in the neighborhood of Hugua Rey, Santaní District.

The group is in its fifth cycle with 12 members.  It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, supportive, and responsible.  The members have great entrepreneurial spirit, since they are current with their payments and intend to finish this stage with very good fulfillment of their responsibilities.  When they receive the loan, many doors open to them for the progress of their work.  The president of the group, Liss Mabel, raises chicks, which she then sells as egg layers or to the poultry shop.  Since the market price for chicks is rising lately, she wants the loan in order to be able to continue with her business, since it is the only source of income she has.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Los Claveles 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Inocencia is the coordinator of her group "Claveles" 1 & 2 (Carnations). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She says that her biggest challenge is to help her daughter to become a professional.

Inocencia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her fruits and vegetables stall, by buying different fruits and vegetables. She will also buy charcoal and meat. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, because she wants to have an improved business. 

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water. None of the water is potable.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Perveen Muhammad Arif's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Kasur, a place known for its tanneries industry in Pakistan. She has lived with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area of Rehmanpura for past 15 years. She has six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of them are getting an education. Perveen couldn’t enroll all of them in school due to financial constraints.
Perveen's husband is M. A.. He is a washerman and runs a laundry business in the community. Perveen and her eldest son also help A. in his business. It has become their family business. M. A. is very good at his work. He is known among his customers for his good customer service and the quality of his work.
Perveen is also a very good housewife. She fulfills her household responsibilities very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s laundry business. With the loan, he will buy an iron for pressing clothes and washing items such as washing powder and bleach etc. to provide better quality services to his customers and earn good profits. He has been operating his business for ten years and Perveen is hopeful about her family’s bright future. She is a new loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy an iron and washing items for laundry business

loans.name: Ave Fenix Group

texts.es:
Margarita forma parte del Banco comunal “Ave Fénix” conformado por 18 emprendedores, que se desempeñan en los rubros de zapatería, peluquería y venta de artículos para regalos, yerbas medicinales, repuestos de bicicletas, vestuario, condimentos, huevos, frutas y verduras. Pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
