Margarita quien en la foto aparece sentada en la segunda fila, con un calendario blanco en sus manos, se dedica a la venta de condimentos, frutos secos, miel y legumbres. Desde hace 8 meses en un local establecido de la vega (mercado), llamado “Frutos del País”.
Margarita compra su mercadería al por mayor, en el mercado y la  miel a un proveedor del producto.
El terreno donde se encuentra su local es provisorio, por lo tanto está postulando a un proyecto en el cual  podrá optar a un terreno propio.
Con este préstamo comprará miel al por mayor.
El sueño de Margarita es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean profesionales. Y respecto a su negocio que éste siga prosperando.
Sus motivaciones de continuar con este negocio son los ingresos generados por éste, los que le permiten brindarles a sus 6 hijos un mejor bienestar y una mejor calidad en la educación. 
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, sobre todo por la buena convivencia y confianza experimentada en el grupo. 
En cuanto al financiamiento que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, ha sido un gran aporte para su negocio.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Margarita is part of the Communal Bank “Ave Fénix” (Phoenix) which consists of eighteen entrepreneurs. They engage in businesses such as manufacturing shoes, managing hair salons, selling gifts, herbal medicines, bicycle parts, clothes, spices, eggs, fruits, and vegetables. The members live in the city of Concepción.

In the photo, Margarita is seated in the second row holding up a white calendar. She sells condiments, dried fruit, honey, and legumes. For the past eight months, she has had a shop established in the market called “Frutos del País” (Fruits of the Country). Margarita buys her goods at the market wholesale and acquires honey from a distributor. The location of her shop is temporary, so she has already started looking for her own piece of land. With this loan, she will purchase honey in bulk.

Margarita dreams of seeing her children continue their studies and become professionals. She also hopes to keep prospering in her business. Her reason for continuing her business is the income it generates, which enables her to provide for the welfare of her six children and give them a better quality education. She is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza. Margarita enjoys participating in meetings, especially for the camaraderie and enthusiasm she experiences as part of the group. Regarding the financing she has received from Fondo Esperanza, the loans have been a great help to her business.

The city of Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Bíobío River, one of the largest in the country, in southern Chile in Bíobío region. This city played an important role in Chilean history since it was the home to major battles, such as the War of Arauco, and a historical settlement since it borders the Mapuche territory. The city is currently undergoing significant economic and demographic development. It is considered to be one of the most important urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers in Chile, just behind Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: Purchase honey

loans.name: Shamshad Khusi Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad has lived in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, called Kot Radha Kishen, for the past 12 years. Kot Radha Kishen is known for its dairy industry. Shamshad lives in a two-roomed brick house located in Rawal Jhangerh.
Her husband has a Punjabi food business. He sells Dahi Bhaley, which is a famous Punjabi dish made up of yogurt, potatoes and spices. He sells it from a four-wheeled cart which he takes around different streets in the city. Shamshad herself is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and carry out her household responsibilities. She is the mother of four sons. She is unable to provide them with an education due to financial constraints. Her elder son has a barber shop and the others stay at home.
Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy ingredients such as spices, potatoes and yogurt etc. to make larger quantites of Dahi Bhaley, which will help him sell more and make more income. He has been operating his business for ten years and Shamshad is hopeful that an investment will generate more profits and expand his business further. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Shamshad.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for Punjabi food (Dahi Bhaley) business

loans.name: Vitelia

texts.es:
Vitelia M. Meléndez   tiene 54 Años y dos hijos en las edades de 28 y 30, que con sus esfuerzos han logrado estudiar y ella confía en que gradualmente sean muy exitosos en lo que se propongan. Ella es una mujer que vive en el municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, lugar donde se producen hermosas artesanías en telar vertical, como hamacas y mochilas tejidas, que muchos extranjeros y habitantes de Colombia conocen y tienen en sus viviendas y/o lugares de campo. Este oficio es una tradición de los Sanjacinteros, que Vitelia  persiste en darle continuidad, por eso  se dedica desde hace ocho años a la elaboración de bolsos,mochilas juego de individuales para mesas y también confecciona uniformes para estudiantes. 
Ella emprendió este negocio cuando se ganó un premio en dinero y lo invirtió en materiales para fabricar   bolsos, contrató artesanas y   así fue como inició su venta, primero  en el mismo municipio y gradualmente fue abriendo mercados  en el sur del departamento de Bolívar y en otras ciudades de Colombia, como hasta ahora lo hace  cuando   envía   productos  a sus clientes, y ellos consignan el dinero en su cuenta de ahorro.
Vitelia como madre  jefa de hogar  ha sacado adelante  a sus hijos con este negocio, del cual se siente muy orgullosa y ha sido su gran desafío porque sueña con que ellos avancen y tengan éxitos profesionales, por eso da  gracias a Dios porque su situación ha cambiado,  tiene un hijo que terminó sus estudios, es profesor y genera ingresos para el hogar y el otro también trabaja; así todos en la familia se ayudan, por eso Vitelia tiene su casa propia y arreglada con el apoyo de sus hijos y todos sus esfuerzos para lograr ingresos, sosteniendo su negocio que es su propio empleo.  
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y con el comprará  hilo para bolsos, cinco pacas, tela para el forro de los bolsos, correderas, hebillas, inversión que augura éxito, debido a que lo que ella produce, siempre lo vende en el mismo municipio o lo envía a otros regiones del país, donde sus clientes están a la expectativa de lo que Vitelia envíe.  En su negocio cuenta con tres personas que trabajan con ella en su casa, sus productos los vende en los almacenes de la comunidad y también tiene clientes en el sur del departamento de Bolívar y otras poblaciones de la Costa Caribe.  El negocio de Vitelia se mueve muy bien: sus cuentas por cobrar las recupera  semanalmente, la mayor parte de sus ventas son de contado, mientras sus compras de materia prima casi siempre  las hace   de contado, aunque muchas veces no alcanza a comprar todo lo que necesita para responder a sus clientes pues  le falta capital y ella  maneja  una rápida rotación de sus inventarios porque los productos que va terminando los entrega inmediatamente.
texts.en:
Vitelia M. Meléndez is 54 years old and has two children, ages 28 and 30. Through her own efforts, she was able to study and gradually become successful in whatever she pursued. This woman lives in the town of San Jacinto in the Department of Bolivar, where she uses her loom to produce beautiful handicrafts such as hammocks and woven handbags. Many foreigners and Colombian residents are familiar with these items and have them in their homes and businesses. This trade is a tradition among the people of San Jacinto, so Vitelia continues the legacy. For the past eight years, she has been making bags, backpacks, individual table settings, as well as student uniforms.

Vitelia started her business after she won some prize money. She invested it in materials for making bags. Vitelia hired artisans and began generating sales, first in San Jacinto, and then she gradually opened new markets to the south in the Department of Bolivar and other cities in Colombia. Now when she ships products to her customers, they deposit their payments into her savings account.

As a mother and head of household, Vitelia is proud of being able to overcome challenges and move her children forward with the help of her business. She dreams of seeing them advance so that they can become successful professionals. Vitelia gives thanks to God that her situation has changed. Her son completed his studies and is now a teacher who contributes to the household income. Vitelia’s other son works since everyone is able to help. She owns her home and is able make repairs with the help of her children and the income from all of their efforts. By sustaining her business, she is able to keep herself employed.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use the funds to buy yarn for making bags, five bales of wool, fabric used for lining the bags, slide fasteners, and clasps. This investment promises to be a success because Vitelia is always able to sell what she produces in the city or ship her products to other regions of the country where her customers can hardly wait to see what she has created. Her business has three employees who work with her in her home. The products are sold to stores in the community as well as to customers in the south in the Department of Bolívar and other towns along the Caribbean coast. Vitelia’s business has very good cash flow. Her accounts indicate that she is able to collect payments each week. Most of her sales are made in cash, while almost all of her purchases for materials are paid in cash. However, there have been several instances when she does not have enough capital to buy everything she needs to respond to her customers. Vitelia manages a quick turnover of her finished goods so that they can be delivered immediately.

loans.use: Purchase yarn, wool, lining fabric, slide fasteners, and clasps for making woven handbags

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es:
Ligia madre soltera, mujer emprendedora, trabajadora ha salido adelante con sus hijos y tiene proyecto de mejorara su vivienda, cumplir con su sueño de que sus hijos se preparen y en ámbito laboral que ella tenga sus tramos en el cual tenga uno de abarrote y el otro una peluquería, ya que tiene conocimiento en el ramo de la belleza. Como fuente de trabajo tiene su pulpería que su hijo le apoya en la venta, también la peluquería y alquila cuartos para universitarios.  Inicio su pulpería con fondo propios y poco apoco ha ido aumentando sus ventas. 
El préstamo que solicitad es para agrandar su inventario con la compra de nuevas y variada mercadería como: artículos escolares, bisutería, perfumes, granos básicos, productos enlatados, bebidas y otros. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a su desarrollo como micro empresaria que es.
texts.en: Ligia is a single mother. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman, who has provided for her children and now has a project to improve their home. Her dream is to ensure her children have a good education and, in terms of work, for one to have a grocery shop and the other a hairdressers. Ligia herself has a small grocery shop and a hairdressers. She also rents out rooms to university students. She opened her grocery shop with her own savings and gradually increased her sales over time. She will use the loan to broaden the range of products she sells, to include new and varied merchandise such as: school stationery; inexpensive jewellery; perfumes; basic cereals; canned produce; and drinks. She is very grateful for the financial support, to help develop her small enterprise.

loans.use: compra de productos

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
Sixta mujer trabajadora, madre soltera con sus propios esfuerzo le brinda  a sus hijos el sustentó diario, también sus hijos le ayudan ya que venden galletita,  planes para su familia mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos se superen.
Tiene su propio negocio su puesto de venta de tortillas, se le presenta dificultades cuando se enferma ya que abandona su trabajo reiniciando al momento que se mejora. El puesta localizado en su casa.
El préstamo que solicitad es para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, leña. Agradeciéndole a la financiera por su apoyo para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sixta is a hardworking woman and single mother.  Through her own efforts she supports her children day to day.  Her children also help her, selling cookies.  Her plans for her family are to improve their house and for her children to better themselves. 

She has her own business, a stand selling tortillas.  It presents difficulties when she gets sick, since she has to stop working, starting again when she gets better.  The stand is located in her house.

The loan she is asking for is to buy corn and firewood.  She thanks the organization for its support for the development of her business.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make tortillas

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is 43 years old. She has two daughters, aged 22 and 23, who are working and studying, and one granddaughter who is four years old. She is a member of the communal bank "Maria Celeste" and has been a member of FINCA Peru for five years now, after being invited by a friend. She has been selling candy from a mobile cart in Ayacucho for 17 years. She will be using her loan of 2,000 PEN to purchase sweets/candy at a wholesale market.

loans.use: To buy candy at the wholesale market

loans.name: Hakim Mubarik Ali's Group

texts.en:
Hakim lives in the small Pakistani city of Kot Radha Kishan, which is famous for its dairy industry. She has lived in the area of Rawal Jhangerh in a three-roomed brick house with her family for the past 30 years. She doesn’t have any children and spends her time carrying out her household responsibilities. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he takes lands on contract to grow different seasonal crops and vegetables. Basically, he is a farmer by profession. He has been engaged in this business for 25 years and has vast experience.
Hakim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to invest in his business. With the loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizers to grow seasonal crops and to earn more profits from his work. Hakim is a very religious person and has a firm belief in her God that after investing the loan, if her husband works hard, he will definitely gain more profits from his business.
Hakim is a regular loan user of Asasah. She never gives any cause for complaint and always pays her loan installments on time. This is her sixth loan application.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing seasonal crops

loans.name: Marvin David

texts.es: Marvin David tiene  26 años, es casado y muy responsable con sus deberes de padre, por ello vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hijo. Desde muy joven trabajó en diversos oficios, y desde hace 3 años se dedica al oficio de destace de cerdo. Es así que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano todos los días pues tiene que buscar cerdos de buena calidad. Por ello se siente muy contento con su labor, a pesar de ciertos problemas como el transporte. Este es el primer crédito que será destinado para la compra de cerdos y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Marvin David is 26 years old, married and a very responsible father.  He lives in his own home with his son.  From a very early age he has worked in different jobs but for the last three has been buying pigs for butchery sales.  Every morning he starts work early because he has to go out and look for quality pigs.

He is very happy with his job despite the transportation problems he sometimes runs into.  This is his first loan and he plans to use it to buy pigs and other things.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.en: Luis Carlos is 32 years old, married, and has a two-month-old son. He has had a car repair business for eight years now. He buys used or damaged cars, repairs them and then sells them in Ayacucho. Luis Carlos will be using his loan of 2,000 PEN to purchase tools to repair vehicles. He has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year, after being invited by his sister. He is a member of the communal bank "Maria Celeste". He enjoys attending training sessions on business development. Luis Carlos would like to save enough money to buy land to construct his own repair shop, as at the moment he works out of other people's shops.

loans.use: To purchase tools for vehicle repair

loans.name: Nerly

texts.es:
Nerly  G. tiene un negocio de variedades donde vende papelería, cosméticos  y accesorios femeninos.  Ella con un pequeño capital deicidio empezar a vender productos de belleza y le fue muy bien cuando comenzó a ganar clientes y  a reinvertir sus ganancias;  así fue que cuando   fue creciendo en mercado,  adicionó tres vitrinas para organizarlo mejor y  lograr una imagen empresarial apropiada.  Con su negocio   ha logrado responder a sus gastos personales y   a las necesidades de su hijo.  Su sueño y gran desafío es convertirlo   en un gran almacén para continuar aumentando sus utilidades y brindarle una educación que le asegure muchos éxitos profesionales  a su hijo. Aun que posee un capital de trabajo, muchas veces requiere de más dinero para responder a los clientes, pues aun no tiene todo lo que ellos piden y su meta es tener   un poco  de cada producto para que ellos encuentren   lo necesario y Nerly logre el posicionamiento de su negocio.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también su primer  credikiva con el cual  comprará útiles escolares, interiores, accesorios de vestir y sandalias, aprovechando la temporada escolar, que es la que impera en este momento, en el que jóvenes y adultos ingresan a clases y sus productos rotan frecuentemente.
texts.en:
Nerly G. has her own business selling stationery supplies, cosmetics and ladies' accessories.  With a little bit of capital she began selling beauty products and was so successful once she established a customer base that she decided to reinvest her earnings.  She added three display cases to enhance her corporate image and began growing in the market.  Through her business she has been able to cover her personal expenses and meet her son's needs.  

Her dream and biggest challenge is to expand and have a shop one day so she can increase earning and give her son a good education so he can have a successful career.  Though she has her own working capital, many times she needs more money to meet customer demand.  Her goal is to be able to stock a little bit of everything so she can position her business well.

This is Nerly's first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She plans to use it to buy school material, clothing accessories and sandals for the school year which is about to begin.  Her products have a high rotation rate now that youths and adults are going back to school.

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies, school materials, ladies' accessories and school shoes

loans.name: Duo Jardin Del Eden Group

texts.es:
DUO. JARDIN  DEL EDEN.
AMALIA FERNANDA M.. TIENE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD ES RECIEN CASADA NO TIENE NINGUN HIJO, ELLA DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MEDICINA NATURAL, ELLA DICE QUE NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTO PARA SURTIR SU MERCADERIA PORQUE HAY MEDICINA QUE TIENE MUCHA DEMANDA Y QUE ELLA NO PUEDE OBTENER EN CANTIDAD, PARA ESO NECESITA SU CREDITO,PARA COMPRA DE MEDICINA NATURAL.
ISABEL T. O.. ELLA VIVE SOLA PORQUE SUS HIJAS YA SE CASARON Y ELLA SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE MEDICINA NATURAL, PERO ELLA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A HACER LAVADO DE ROPA EN CASAS ESO LA A AYUDADO PARA SER PROPAGANDA Y ES POR ESA RAZON QUE TIENE MEJORES VENTAS DE SUS PRODUCTOS PORQUE CUANDO ELLA LLEGA OFRECE SU PRODUCTO Y LA GENTE SE INTERESA Y OBTIENE MEJORES GANANCIAS
SOLICITA ESTE CREDITO PARA COMPRA DE MEDICINA NATURAL.
texts.en:
The "Duo Jardin del Eden" group is comprised of two people.  Amalia Fernanda M. is 22 years old and was just married.  She has no children.  She has been selling natural medicines for two years.  She needs the loan to buy more products since there are certain medicines that are in very high demand. She plans to use the loan to buy more natural medicines since she is unable to buy large quantities.  

Isabel T. O. lives alone now that her daughters are married.  She sells natural medicines and also washes clothing for other households.  This has helped her promote her business.  She offers her products to her customers and is able to obtain more income.  She plans to use the loan to buy natural medicines.

loans.use: To buy natural medicines

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El señor José Francisco,  tiene la edad de 64 años , habita la comarca lomas del Gavilán ubicado en Masaya en lo que corresponde a la zona Rural; junto a su esposa que es ama de casa y  sus tres hijos ya todos independientes y laboran en diversas actividades lo cual le permite que le apoyen  los fines de semana en el cultivo de  yuca ,   don S. desde hace 45 años  trabaja en sus tierras como pequeño agricultor  trabajando  cultivo de yuca que es su fuerte demanda y granos básico . Por la situación económica, pérdidas de cosechas y otros factores que le afectan no ha logrado comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para tener una buena producción y poder vender a un mejor precio; pero para esto poder realizarse necesita de un financiamiento agrícola para poder inducir todas las plantas. El mayor sueño de don José es poder establecer barreras vivas en el perímetro de la finca.
texts.en: José Francisco is 64 years old.  He lives in the Lomas del Gavilán region, located in a rural area of Masaya department.  He lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and his three children, who are all already independent and work in various occupations which allow them to help him on the weekends growing yucca.  For the last 45 years, Mr. S. has worked on his land as a small farmer growing yucca, which is in high demand and is a basic staple.  Due to the economic situation, lost crops, and other factors affecting him, he has not been able to buy fertilizer and supplies necessary in order to have a good harvest and to be able to sell at a better price.  In order to do this, he needs an agricultural loan in order to be able to fertilize all his plants.  José's greatest dream is to be able to establish hedgerows around the perimeter of his farm.

loans.use: Fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Rosas Del Pedregal Group

texts.es: Rosas del Pedregal es un banco D. emprendimiento conformada por 8 socias que viven en la zona del pedregal, al sur D. la ciudad,  Es una zona que aun no esta urbanizada por lo que no cuentan con muchos servicios básicos como el agua. Aunque para los habitantes D. esta zona esto no representa dificultad, La  presidenta del banco es la Sra. Alicia que se dedica a la confección y arreglo D. prendas D. vestir y también trabaja como cocinera en una pensión D. la ciudad. Ella vive con sus tres hijos aun en la etapa escolar. Y su esposo que se dedica al trabajo D. transportista.  La Sra. comprara maquinas D. costura con el préstamo,  para D. esta manera incrementar su capital D. trabajo, es una persona trabajadora  Y agradece la colaboración que se le otorga, todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan a su familias adelante, están agradecidas con a institución por el apoyo brindado.ojo en la foto una D. las socias esta acompañado D. su esposo.
texts.en:
"Rosas D. Pedregal" is an entrepreneurial bank group comprised of 8 women who live in the Pedregal area in the southern part of the city.  This area is still underdeveloped and does not have many basic utilities such as running water.  But this does not represent difficulties for the population living in this area.  

The president of the bank, Mrs. Alicia, is a seamstress and also works as a cook in a hostel in the city.  She lives with her three school-aged children.  Her husband works in the transportation sector.  Alicia plans to use the loan to increase her working capital and buy a sewing machine.  She is a very hard-working person and grateful for the support she has received.  

All of the members are dependable, hard-working women who in many cases are the ones responsible for their families getting ahead.  They are grateful to the institution for the support received.  N.B.  One of the members is accompanied by her husand in the photo.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Hatun Warmi ("gran Mujer") Group

texts.es:
Yessica Q. Z., 35 años de edad, casada, con 02 niños de 4 y 8 años respectivamente. Yessica es la presidenta de la alcancìa comunal " Hatun Warmi", que significa "Gran Mujer"; este grupo comunal pertenece a la localidad de Cajas Chico en la cuidad de Huancayo.
Yessica lleva 08 años en el negocio de venta de artefactos para el hogar, y trabaja en conjunto con su esposo Ademir, quien es tècnico; apoyàndose mutuamente hicieron crecer el negocio para que puedan tener mayor ingresos; ella vendiendo los artefactos y su esposo en el àrea de reparaciòn de los mismo como tècnico electricista que es de profesiòn.
Yessica tiene a su cargo a sus pequeños hijos, Naomi de 08 años y Jeff de 04 años; ellos se han convertido en el impulso para seguir esforzàndose, pues desea darles un futuro mejor al que ella tuvo.
El prèstamo serà para ampliar el local y comprar otros electrodomèsticos para aumentar las ventas.
(En la fotografìa, Yessica esta vestida de jeans color azul claro, y un chaleco de color verde con beige; y es la segunda de la izquierda)
texts.en:
Yessica Q. Z. is 35 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 8.  Yessica is the president of the "Hatun Warmi" communal bank which means "Great Woman".  This group is located in the Cajas Chico area in the city of Huancayo.

Yessica has been selling household appliances for 8 years.  She works with her husband Ademir who is a technician.  Together they have been able to grow their business and obtain a higher income.  She sells the appliances and her husband takes care of repair services since he is an electrician by profession.

Yessica cares for her small children, Naomi, 8 and Jeff, 4.  They are the reason she continues to work hard so she can provide a better future for them than the one she had.

She plans to use the loan to expand her shop and buy more appliances, thereby increasing sales.  (In the photo, Yessica is the one in light blue jeans and a green and beige sweater, second from the left.)

loans.use: To buy household appliances

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 02 hijos.  Solo estudió hasta la secundaria. 
La señora hace un año y medio que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de bordados de bayeta (tela artesanal).  Actualmente elabora junto a su esposo muebles de madera.
Con éste crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará quince unidades de madera, para la fabricación de muebles como ropero, mesas, sillas, etc., y comprará lanas para sus tejidos,  también cuenta que se dedican a la chacra y tienen animales como ovejas y vacas.  Ella cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Su sueño es tener una empresa de fabricación de muebles bien implementada.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She only completed her elementary education.

This lady has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling embroideries made on baize (a craft fabric).  She currently makes wooden furniture together with her husband.  She will use this loan to buy fifteen units of wood for making furniture such as wardrobes, tables, chairs, etc.  She will also buy wool for her knitting.  Rosa tells us that she and her husband also work on their farm and have animals such as sheep and cows.  She is helped by her children.

Rosa's dream is to own a well-equipped furniture-making business.  What she likes about her community bank are the meetings and the ease of the loan.

loans.use: To buy fifteen units of wood for making furniture such as wardrobes, tables, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs to fatten

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Jhonatan es un joven de  21 años  a su corta edad es muy emprendedor y trabajador  todo lo que ha logrado  es admirable el estudio para técnico en computadoras  así poco a poco fue ofreciendo sus servicios a domicilio para realizar arreglos de computadoras e instalación de programas, al  juntar algo de dinero  empezó con su propio negocio que tiene por nombre  “JOHAN.NET”  el cual funciona en su misma casa donde ofrece sus servicios para arreglos en general, de otro lado también tiene cabinas telefónicas donde la gente acude para realizar llamadas , realmente le va bien ya tiene clientela ganada que lo conoce y sabe de su buen trabajo, el acaba de ser nombrado el nuevo presidente del grupo “JOVENES EMPRENDEDORES”  07 miembros  lo conforman. Para el futuro el quisiera ampliar su negocio, el dinero de su prestamos será de gran utilidad para el ya que le servirá para la compra de algunas herramientas y repuestos que le hacen falta, con esto el puede ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

* Jhonatan es el cuarto de los parados (derecha)viste polo crema
texts.en:
Jhonatan is a young man of 21.  Even at his young age, he is a very enterprising and hard-working man.  Everything he has achieved is to be admired.  He studied to become a computing technician and gradually started offering his service in people's homes, fixing computers and installing programs.  This allowed him to gather some money together and he started his own business called "Johan.net" which he runs from home, offering his services doing general repairs.

Jhonatan also has telephone booths which people come to use to make calls.  His business is going really well.  The customers he has attracted know him and know about the good work that he does.  

Jhonatan has just been named the new president of the "Jovenes Emprendedores" (Young Entrepreneurs) group which has 7 members.

In the future, Jhonatan would like to expand his business.  His loan money will be very useful to him since he will use it to buy some tools and spare parts that he needs.  This will enable him to offer his customers a better service.

* Jhonatan is the fourth person along of those standing in the photo (on the right), wearing a cream-colored top.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Lirio” (Iris). She is 44 years old, married, and has 8 children, four of which are still in school. She has had a small grocery store in her home for the last three years. She will be using her loan of 3,000 PEN to purchase fruits, vegetables, and other supplies for her grocery store. She purchases the goods in one of the large markets in Ayacucho. Andrea has been a member of FINCA Peru for five years and likes that they encourage her to save and teach her how to deal with clients. She would like to continue saving to be able to renovate her home.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene dos hijos, realizo estudios de educación superior. 
La señora es una socia nueva, recientemente se incorpora como socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para implementar su tienda de abarrotes, comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites, etc.  También nos cuenta que trabaja en la chacra junto con su esposo quien es trabajador en  el municipio de Ilave.
Su sueño es llenar la tienda con diversos productos y tener una buena casa propia.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad de pago.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 37 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a high school education.

This lady is a new member who has recently joined Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Her first loan is for 1,000 Peruvian soles and she will invest the money in setting up her grocery store.  She will buy rice, sugar, noodles, oils, etc.  She also tells us that she works on the farm together with her husband who works for the town of Ilave.

Georgina's dream is to fill her store with a variety of products and to own a good home.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of making loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, oils, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Juvenal

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene 78 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y viven en la ciudad de Calca provincia de Cusco, Perú. Oscar fue policía y nos cuenta que se retiro de la Policía Nacional del Perú hace varios años atras, él recibe un pequeño sueldo que el estado le da por haber brindado servircio a su país y con este dinero lo utiliza para el gasto familiar pero lamentablemente no le alcanza, pero en esta oportunidad  el requiere el préstamo para comprar más víveres como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más.     

Oscar pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Oscar is 78 years old and has two children. They live in the city of Calca in the Province of Cusco, Peru. Oscar was a policeman and he tells us that he retired from the Peruvian National Police several years back. He receives a small salary from the state for having served his country and he uses this money for family expenses. However, it is not enough. Right now, he needs the loan to buy more groceries like rice, sugar, pasta, and many other items.

Oscar belongs to the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank within Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by the loan and promises to make his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy more groceries like rice, sugar, pasta, and many other items

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: La Señora Mari Leticia C.: es de 38 años de edad tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que estudian actual mente es casada su esposo trabaja actualmente en la capital, ella tiene 7 años de tener su tienda de consumo diario ella espera creser con este credito que le pueda otorgar FAPE y KIVA ya que desea surtir su tienda con productos comestibles, ella le da gracias a Dios por estas organizaciones que si no fuera por ellos ella no podrilla crecer como emprasaria y estar mejor aconomicamente ya que el dinero no le alcanza solicita este credito para compra de productos comestibles para la venta, espera en Dios poder lograr su objetivo que es que sus hijos sean unos profecionales en el futuro.
texts.en: Mari Leticia C. is 38 years old and has two young children who are in school.  She is married and her husband currently works in the capital.  She has had her store selling items for daily use for seven years.  With this loan granted by FAPE and Kiva, she hopes to grow since she wants to stock her store with food items.  She thanks God for these organizations because if it were not for them, she would not be able to grow as a businesswoman and would not be better off financially as the money is not enough.  She is requesting this loan to buy food items to sell.  She hopes that God will help her achieve her goal for her children to be professionals in the future.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad del Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Olga trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud en el área administrativa, ella nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña botica. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Olga en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar medicamentos.  

Olga pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Olga is 50 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the city of Calca in the Department of Cusco, Peru. Olga works for the Ministry of Health in the area of administration. She tells us that she has a small pharmacy. She has been in this business for 10 years and she does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Right now, Olga needs the loan to buy medicines.

Olga belongs to the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank within Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided with the loan and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y tiene 02 hijos.  Sólo estudió hasta 5º de educación secundaria. 
Hace un año y medio viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de animales  como vacunos, ovinos, etc.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, comprará cuatro cabezas de vaca lechera y 1 chancho.  También cuenta que trabaja en la chacra junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es mejorar el ganado, tener una casa grande y un carro.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la capacitación que recibe por parte de su promotora.
texts.en:
Rosa María is a member of the "Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She only studied up to the fifth year of her secondary education.

Rosa María has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she used that money in her business selling animals such as cattle, sheep, etc.

Rosa María will use this loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy four head of dairy cows and one pig.  She also tells us that she works on the farm together with her husband.  Her dream is to improve her livestock and to own a large house and a car.

What Rosa María likes about her community bank are the meetings and the training that she receives.

loans.use: To buy four head of dairy cows and one pig

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Libia, tiene 56 años de edad, es divorciada, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la ciudad del Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Libia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la atender su tienda de abarrotes. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Libia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas para abastecer su tienda.   

Libia pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Libia, 56, has 4 children, is divorced, and lives in the city of Calca in Cusco department, Peru.  After finishing up her housework, she works in her grocery store. She has had this business for 15 years and it’s going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time Libia needs a loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, noodles and other products to supply her store.

Libia belongs to the Señor de Huanca communal bank of the Arawira Association.  She is thankful for the opportunity offered her with this financing and she promises to complete her payments in the required time.

loans.use: To buy items such as rice, sugar, noodles and other products to supply her store

loans.name: Neli Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, tiene 57 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y nació en la ciudad de Lamay y actualmente Lucila  vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Lucila después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica al atender su tienda de abarrotes. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Lucila en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo gaseosas, cervezas, arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas para abastecer su tienda.   

Lucila pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucila is 57 years old and the mother of two children. She was born in Lamay, but lives now in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. After having finished her household chores, Lucila works in her grocery store. She has been in this business for 15 years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Lucila currently needs a loan to buy merchandise, such as soft drinks, beer, rice, sugar, noodles and other products to stock up her store.

Lucila is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as soft drinks, beer, rice, sugar, noodles and other products to stock up her store

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
María vive en la Zona D. Raúl D. Porras Barrenechea, distrito D. Carabayllo, tiene 43 años, conviviente, tiene 4  hijos; uno menor y los tres mayores. Recientemente integra el grupo “La Esperanza”, formado por 10 integrantes, ella es una D. las socias. 
Trabaja vendiendo comida al paso, inicio hace tres años trabajando en la Municipalidad, en un depósito, ahí vendía comida a los trabajadores. Gracias al AlcalD. ella pudo trabajar ahí, pero por motivos personales tuvo que abandonar ese lugar, y entonces decidió poner su negocio en su casa vendiendo a los moto taxistas D. la zona, también trabaja lavando ropa y limpiando las casas D. sus vecinos. Uno D. sus sueños es alquilar un local para la venta D. comida. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en la compra D. insumos para la venta D. alimentos asi como para el alquiler D. local para la venta.
texts.en:
María lives in Raúl D. Porras Barrenechea neighborhood, in Carabayllo district.  She is 43 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 children: one is still young and the other three are grown up.  She recently joined the "La Esperanza" (Hope) group which has 10 members, including herself.  

María works selling meals in the street.  Three years ago she started working for the Council, in a warehouse.  She sold meals to the workers there.  She was able to work there thanks to the Mayor but, for personal reasons, she had to leave the job.  She decided to set up a business at home selling to the drivers of 'mototaxis' (motorbikes with cabins in the back for transporting passengers) in the area.  She also works washing clothes and cleaning her neighbors' houses.  One of her dreams is to rent premises where she can sell her meals.

María would like to invest her loan money in buying supplies for her food business and renting premises for her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Karen Rocío

texts.es:
Roció, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y nació en la ciudad de Cusco. Actualmente, Rocio vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Roció es profesora y no tiene un trabajo estable pero ella enseño el año 2010 en el colegio “La Merced” de Calca. Actualmente, Roció está esperando que empiece el año escolar para que cualquier colegio la pueda contratar. Roció también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y pollos. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Roció en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas animales menores como pollos y cuyes. 
 
Roció pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rocío is 30 years old and the mother of three children. She was born in the city of Cusco, but lives now in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Rocío is a teacher, but has no permanent job. In 2010 she taught at the "Colegio La Merced" in Calca. She waits for the new school term to begin, so that some school may hire her. Rocío also breeds small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She has done that for two years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Rocío currently needs a loan to buy more small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs.

Rocío is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy more small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Manana 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Bibiana is the coordinator of her group "Trabajando para el Manana" 1, 2 & 3 (Working for tomorrow). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children. She says that her biggest challenge is to help her children to become a professionals.

Bibiana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 2 years, starting to work out of her house after her partner in love gave her money to start her business. She plans to use this loan to buy an oven, as she operates a "empanada" sales business. Empanada is a round of flour filled with meat or vegetables and fried, a popular snack or food.

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Samana. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water, none of which is potable.

loans.use: to buy an oven

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde, tiene 33 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y nació en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Matilde es elaborar pan, ella nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño horno en su domicilio donde elabora su rico pan. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Matilde en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de harinas. 

Matilde pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Matilde is 33 years old and the mother of three children. She was born in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her main economic activity is baking bread. She has a small oven at home where she bakes her rich bread. She has done that for six years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Matilde currently needs a loan to buy several sacks of flour.

Matilde is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of flour

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 58 años oriunda del departamento de Santa Cruz provincia Santa Rosa del Sara, actualmente vive en la zona de San José dese hace 40 años. Su actividad es la elaboración de pan en su domicilio donde vende  por mayor y menor hace 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad,    y como segunda actividad cuenta con el alquiler de tres cuartos en su domicilio de los cuales percibe ingresos mensuales. Su Estado civil es viuda hace 5 años,  la Sra. cuenta con 1 hija  que se encuentra en edad escolar y 2 que ya son independientes con el dinero del crédito comprara material de construcción para hacer construir un cuarto para que funcione su panadería. La Sra. se encuentra muy agradecida por haber confiado nuevamente en su persona  y por haberle dado una oportunidad.
texts.en: María is 58 years old. She is from the departament of Santa Cruz, province of Santa Rosa del Sara. She has lived in the area of San José for 40 years. Her activity is making bread in her house. She has sold it wholesale and retail for the 18 years she has spent doing this activity. As a second activity, she rents out three rooms in her house and from that makes monthly income. She has been a widow for 5 years. She has 1 daughter who is schoolaged and 2 who are grown. With the money from the loan, she will buy construction materials to build a room to run her bread bakery in. She is very grateful for being trusted and given this opportunity again.

loans.use: To build a room for a bread bakery

loans.name: Marizol

texts.es:
Marizol, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene un hijo y nació en la ciudad de Huanuco. Actualmente Marizol vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Matilde es la crianza y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y pollos. Ya son  varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Marizol en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar de 4 a 5 chanchos. 

Marizol pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marizol is 38 years old and the mother of one child. She was born in the city of Huanuco, but lives now in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her main economic activity consists in breeding and selling small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Marizol currently needs a loan to buy 4 or 5 pigs.

Marizol is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy 4 or 5 pigs

loans.name: Justina Antonia

texts.es:
Justina, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y nació en la ciudad de Arequipa y actualmente Justina vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Justina es la compra y venta de maíz. Ya son  varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Justina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz. 

Justina pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Justina is 38 years old and the mother of three children. She was born in the city of Arequipa, but lives now in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her main economic activity consists in buying and selling corn. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Justina currently needs a loan to buy corn.

Justina is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa, tiene 59 años D. edad, tiene dos hijos y nació en la ciudad D. Urubamba y actualmente Justina vive en la ciudad D. Calca del departamento D. Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal D. Justina es la agricultura pero también tiene un carro que lo está utilizando para servicio D. transporte rural. Ya son  varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Teresa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. 

Teresa pertenece al banco comunal “Señor D. Huanca” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Teresa is 59 years old and the mother of two children. She was born in the city of Urubamba, but lives now in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her main economic activity consists in farming, but she also owns a car that she uses to proviD. rural transportation services. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Teresa currently needs a loan to service her car.

Teresa is a member of the communal bank "Señor D. Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To service the car that she uses to provide rural transportation services

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros, tiene 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Milagros nos cuenta que realizo sus estudios en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco y estudió la carrera profesional de Biología. Actualmente,  Milagros ejerce su profesión.  Ya son  varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Milagros en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para el alimentos de sus hijos.    

Milagros pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Milagros is 39 years old and the mother of two children. She lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. She studied biology at the National University Antonio Abad in Cusco. Currently she works in her specialization. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Milagros currently needs a loan to pay alimony for her children.

Milagros is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To pay alimony for her children

loans.name: Jose Leonzo

texts.es: El señor José Leonzo es un pequeño agricultor del municipio de Ticuantepe, casado con una comerciante del mismo municipio junto a su tres hijos en edades de 26 a 20 años ya casados e independiente,  los planes  a futuro es poder establecer un pequeños sistema de riego  para su cultivo de hortaliza que será de un gran beneficios para él , desde hace 40 años don José se dedica al cultivo de piña .La mayor dificultad es el daño de los gases del volcán ,la baja de precio en la piñas y otros factores que afectan la misma ; el inicio esta actividad agrícola gracias al apoyo de las tierras que le brindo su papá para que las trabajara y poder sostener a su familia .Don José necesita financiamiento para poder aplicar plaguicidas y fertilizantes .Ya que obteniendo mejores recursos podrá vender a un mejor precio y pagar lo que se le prestado en tiempo y forma .
texts.en: Mr. Jose Leonzo is a small farmer in the municipality of Ticuantepe.  He is married to a businesswoman in the same town and together they have three children between the ages of 20 and 26, all married and independent.  His future plans are to be able to establish a small irrigation system for his food crops which would be very beneficial to him.  For 40 years, Jose has cultivated pineapple.  The major challenges are damage from volcanic gases, the low prices of pineapple, and other factors that affect it.   He began this agricultural activity thanks to the help of his father who gave him land so that he could work on it and sustain his family.  Jose needs a loan to be able to apply pesticides and fertilizers, since with better resources he'll be able to sell at a higher price and pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Eykel Ramon

texts.es: El Señor Eykel Ramón tiene 26 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Tiene más de 2 años en este negocio. La buena administración de su negocio ha hecho que siga adelante con este medio de vida, que es elemental para mantener a su familia. Por iniciativa propia fue el empezó este negocio y con ciertos productos como es pantalones, camisa, faldas, trajes entre otros y así tiene una gran variedad de público. El solicitante requiere del crédito para comprar una gran variedad de pacas ya que tiene ciertos pedidos de sus clientes. Presenta buenas referencias tanto en lo labor como personal además tiene experiencia en este medio de vida.
texts.en: Mr. Eykel Ramón is 26 years old. He sells used clothing. He has worked in this business for more than 2 years. The good administration of his business has enabled him to get ahead with this way of making a living, and it is elemental for supporting his family. He started this business on his own iniative with certain products, such as pants, shirts, skirts, suits among other things. He always has a good variety of customers. The applicant requires the loan to buy various packs of clothing, since he has had some orders from customers. He has good work and persona references and experience making a living in this manner.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio, tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Braulio nos cuenta que se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte y brinda servicio en la ruta de Cusco, Calca y viceversa. Ya son  varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Braulio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para hacer mantenimiento del carro.    

Braulio pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Braulio is 51 years old and lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. He provides transportation services, namely on the route from Cusco to Calca and return. He has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Braulio currently needs a loan to service his car.

Braulio is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To service his car

loans.name: Paulo Cesar

texts.es:
Paulo, tiene 33 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica de Paulo es la pintura. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Paulo en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar oleos, pintura entres otras cosas. 

Paulo pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Paulo is 33 years old and the father of three children. He lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. His main economic activity consists in painting. He has done that for 12 years and earned a good income thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Paulo currently needs a loan to buy oil and paint, among others.

Paulo is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy oil and paint

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is 53 years old, and has four children, two of which are completing their university studies. She owns a store where she has been selling groceries, sodas and gifts for 7 years. She was selling goods at a stand in a local market for 8 years prior to opening her store, and said she began her business when she became a member of FINCA Peru 14 years ago. The trainings that FINCA Peru offered were very helpful to her in the beginning when she was just starting her business. She will be using her loan of 2,400 PEN to purchase grocery supplies in addition to gifts and school supplies for the upcoming school year. Rosalia is a member of the communal bank "Morenita Huamanga".

loans.use: To purchase supplies for grocery store

loans.name: Flor Ninnette

texts.es:
Flor, tiene 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica de Flor es la administración de un Grifo. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Flor  en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para comprar ropa, alimentación y educación para sus hijos. 

Flor pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Flor is 39 years old and the mother of two children. She lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her economic activity consists in running a filling station. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Flor currently needs a loan to pay for clothes, food and education for her children.

Flor is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To pay for clothes, food and education for her children

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, está  casada y  tiene 02 hijos.  La señora sólo estudio educación secundaria. 
Hace cuatro meses que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su tienda, comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas y galletas.  Trabaja junto con su esposo.  Además trabajan en la chacra sembrando papa, cebada, forraje, etc.
Su sueño es tener una casa en Ilave y tener un carro que les permita movilizarse.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She has a high school education.

Georgina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four months.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her grocery store business.  She is requesting a new loan for 500 Peruvian soles to invest in her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, noodles, soda and cookies.  She works together with her husband.  They also work on the farm growing potatoes, barley, fodder, etc.

Georgina's dream is to own a house in Ilave and to own a car that will allow her to get around.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, soda and cookies

loans.name: Reyna Ester

texts.es:
La Sra. Reyna L. tiene 45 años de edad y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de donas y relámpagos.
su negocio se a convertido en una micro empresa en donde paga dos empleados uno de sexo femenino que le ayuda a la elaboración del producto y uno de sexo masculino quien es el encargado de distribuir el producto.
Su especialidad es fabricar Donas con cerezas, la Donas con Azúcar de diferentes tamaños y los Relámpagos.
toda la reposteria que elabora es de un sabor exquisito.
Doña Reyna ya tiene clientes con contrato permanente y todo el producto que elabora solo lo entrega, sus  clientes son dueñas de casetas en algunos centros de estudio de la ciudad de Danli.
Doña Reina es madre soltera con tres hijos de los cuales ya solo una depende de ella, le cubre todos los gastos y actualmente esta cursando sus estudios primarios.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las donas.
texts.en:
Reyna L. is 45 years old and works making and selling donuts and eclairs.  Her business has become a small company and she pays two employees: a woman who helps make the products and a man who is in charge of distributing them.

Reyna's speciality is making cherry donuts, different sized sugar donuts and eclairs.  All the confectionery she makes is absolutely delicious.

Reyna has customers with whom she has a permanent contract and she delivers all her products.  Her customers are women who own food stands in educational centers in the city of Danli.

Reyna is a single mother who has three children, only one of whom (a daughter) is still dependent.  Her daughter is currently in elementary school and she covers all her expenses.

Reyna will use her loan money to buy materials for making her donuts.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, sugar, oil, eggs, baking soda and yeast

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 45 años, vive sola en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años tiene su tienda, negocio que ella misma atiende todos los días, y con mucho animo y el buen trato ha hecho que su establecimiento sea el más concurrido. Siempre esta en búsqueda de otorgar ofertas a sus clientes, ya que de eso depende que su negocio siga manteniéndose. Una de las cualidades que cree poseer, es el orden que siempre lleva en sus cuentas y eso le permite saber cuanto gana por cada producto que vende en su tienda, ya que no solo vende productos sino algunos artículos para el hogar y balones de gas. Es por ello que desea tener una tienda más amplia llena de mercadería y muy variada. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta y motivada de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.
texts.en:
Nancy is 45 years old and lives alone in her own home.  She has owned her store for more than three years and works in it every day.  Through a lot of effort and good customer service, her establishment has become very popular.  Nancy is always looking to provide her customers with offers since the survival of her business depends on it.  One of the qualities that Nancy believes herself to possess is the ability to keep her accounts in order.  This allows her to know how much she earns for every product that she sells in her store.  She doesn't only sell food products but also some household items and gas cylinders.  She would like to have a bigger store, full of a large variety of merchandise.

This is Nancy's first loan with MFP.  She is very happy and motivated to know that she has financial support and she is grateful to everybody who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Vilma Rosa

texts.es:
Vilma O. C., tiene 53 años de edad y se dedica a la comercialización de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y para niños, en un puesto comercial que queda en el centro de Barranquilla, un lugar bien concurrido por peatones. El negocio de Vilma inició hace 16 años,  cuando llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, procedente del municipio de Fundación en el departamento del Magdalena, pues   su hijo requería ingresar  a la universidad   para continuar sus estudios y a    Vilma   se le ocurrió vender  sabanas y toallas encargadas  por muchos conocidos, a los cuales otorgaba crédito. Con el paso del tiempo fue ampliando su inventario y agregó otras mercancías, como calcetines, conjuntos de niños y ropa interior para damas, caballeros e infantil, pero eso si siempre ha sido apoyada por su esposo en sus proyectos de vida y esto la inspira a seguir adelante.  
Vilma se acercó a la Fundación a tramitar su primer financiamiento,  pues quiere cumplir su sueño de tener un negocio donde no pague arriendo, por eso con su credikiva que también es su primer crédito,  comprará la prima del puesto comercial en el que se encuentra vendiendo mercancías  y  que en la actualidad no es de su propiedad ; ella argumenta que su inversión tendrá mucho éxito  porque no tendrá que pagar arriendo por el espacio locativo y esto la ayudará a disminuir los precios de sus productos y alcanzar un mayor volumen de ventas competitivas y a nivel personal la satisfacción de  avanzar en su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Vilma O. C. is 53 years old and her business is selling men's, women's and children's clothes from a spot in the center of Barranquilla, in an area that is has a lot of foot traffic.  Vilma started her business 16 years ago when she arrived in the city of Barranquilla from the town of Fundación, in Magdalena department as her son wanted to enter university to continue his studies.  Vilma decided to sell sheets and towels that a lot of acquaintances ordered and she offered her goods on credit.  Over time, she expanded her inventory and added other merchandise such as socks, children's outfits and men's, women's and children's underwear.  However, she has always been supported by her husband in all her projects in life and this inspires her to keep going.

Vilma approached Fundación Leon 2000 to request her first loan as she would like to achieve her dream of owning a business where she doesn't pay rent.  For this reason, she will use her Kiva loan, which is also her first loan, to pay for the spot where she sells her merchandise and which she doesn't currently own.  She tells us that her investment will be very successful because she won't have to pay rent for her spot and this will help her to reduce the price of her products and she will reach a larger volume of competitive sales.  It will also give her the personal satisfaction of making progress in her growth as a businesswoman.

loans.use: To pay for the spot where she works

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn in bulk to make tortillas

loans.name: Melicendra

texts.es:
Melicendra, tiene 27 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica de Melicendra es brindar servicio de transporte distrital la ruta de Cusco, Calca y viceversa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Melicendra en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de carro.
   
Melicendra pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Melicendra is 27 years old and the mother of two children. She lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her economic activity consists in providing local transportation services on the route from Cusco to Calca and return. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Melicendra currently needs a loan to service her car.

Melicendra is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To service her car

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura, tiene 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Rosaura en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. 

Rosaura pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 29 years old and the mother of one child. She lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her economic activity consists in breeding small animals like guinea pigs and hens. She has done that for four years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Rosaura currently needs a loan to buy guinea pigs, pigs and hens.

Rosaura is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, pigs and hens

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica de Alicia es la venta de verduras en el mercado de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Alicia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras. 

Alicia pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alicia is 30 years old and the mother of two children. She lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her economic activity consists in selling vegetables at the city market of Urubamba. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Alicia currently needs a loan to buy vegetables.

Alicia is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, tiene 29 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica de Vilma es la venta de maíz de tipo Tara. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Vilma en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz. 

Vilma pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Vilma is 29 years old and the mother of three children. She lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her economic activity consists in selling corn of the "Tara" sort. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Vilma currently needs a loan to buy corn.

Vilma is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Trabajando Hacia El Bienestar 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, "Trabajando hacia el Bienestar" 2 & 3 (Working towards Well-being). She makes her home in a simple structure with her four children. She says that her goal is to work to enable her children to have better living conditions. In the meantime she plans to continue serving her family and others.

Ana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She has been doing business taking different loans, and now she feels stable having Esperanza´s loans. She plans to use this one to invest in her clothing sales, purchasing all kind of clothes. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed capital to develop her business and increase her household income. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's other Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es:
