Celedonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene cuatro hijos, realizo estudios de educación primaria. 
Hace un año y medio que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo  fue de S/. 100.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de cereales como quinua, papa, cebada, cañihua.
Con éste crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará diez arrobas de quinua y ocho arrobas de chuño (harina de papa procesada).  La señora trabaja sola, sus productos los vende en Ilave, Acora, y Puno.  Su esposo trabaja con el ganado y también se va a trabajar fuera de la ciudad para ayudar con los gastos familiares.
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la capacitación y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Celedonia is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 30 years old, married, and has four children.  She completed her primary education.

Celedonia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years.  Her first loan was for 100 Peruvian soles and she used that money to invest in her business buying and selling cereals such as quinoa, potatoes, barley and cañihua (a native grain).

Celedonia will use this loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy ten 11kg sacks of quinoa and eight 11kg sacks of chuño (potato flour).  This lady works alone and sells her products in Ilave, Acora and Puno.  Her husband works as a livestock farmer and he also goes to work outside the city to help with their family expenses.

Celedonia's dreams are to have more capital so that she can improve her business and for her children to become professionals.  What she likes about her community bank are the training sessions and the prompt payment.

loans.use: To buy ten 11kg sacks of quinoa and eight 11kg sacks of chuño (potato flour)

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia Del Carmen tiene 50 años, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos. Tiene más de 4 años en este negocio. Inicio como una forma de ingreso para su hogar tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad a su cargo. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija, entre amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que acuden a su vivienda, pero la mayoría de veces ella tiene que salir de manera ambulante a ofrecer sus productos. Para el  futuro desea establecer su negocio en el mercado, en donde transitan muchos clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de polvos, lápiz labial, tratamientos y pintura de uñas. Esta es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy emocionada.
texts.en:
Sonia Del Carmen is 50 years old.  Her business is selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for more 4 years.  She started her business as a way of making income for her household.  She has 2 grown-up children in her care.

Sonia currently has regular customers amongst her friends in the neighborhood, locals and neighbors who come to her home.  However, most of the time she goes out door to door to offer her products for sale.  In the future, she would like to set up her business in the market where there are a lot of customers.  She is requesting this loan to buy powders, lip sticks, treatments and nail polish.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan and she feels very excited.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Manolo Roberto

texts.es:
Manolo  B. comenzó desde los 18 años su profesión como panadero y  hace 8 años dejo la ciudad de Santa Elena  y llego a playas para ejercer su profesión  de la cual le está yendo mejor. En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a domingos de 7am hasta las 6 de la tarde. No tiene ningún obstáculo en su panadería está casado su esposa le ayuda en el negocio y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en escuela fiscal 

Con el préstamo va a comprar harina, bebidas, manteca. Su sueño para los próximos 5 años es comprar un terreno y hacer su vivienda.
texts.en:
Manolo B. started out in his trade as a baker at the age of 18.  Eight years ago he left the city of Santa Elena and arrived in Playas to carry out his trade and it is doing better.  He currently works from Monday to Sunday, from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  He has nothing to stop him in his bakery.  Manolo is married and his wife helps him in the business.  He has 2 children who attend school. 

Manolo will use his loan to buy flour, drinks and butter.  His dream for the next 5 years is to buy a plot of land and build a home.

loans.use: To buy flour, drinks and butter

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 50 años, vive sola en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra principalmente papa, maíz y arveja entre otros productos. En ocasiones sus hijos la ayudan cuando es temporada de siembra o cosecha, en donde requiere de mayor mano de obra, además contrata el servicio de peones que le permite optimizar el tiempo y vender su cosecha en el mercado local. Para ella es ventajoso desarrollar la agricultura porque le permite tener el alimento disponible, además de que en algunos productos es rentable aunque reconozca que por factores climáticos haya un riesgo de perder la inversión pero sus años de experiencia le dan la capacidad suficiente para  prevenir dentro de sus posibilidades para mejorar, es por eso que seguirá adelante en esta actividad. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta y motivada de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Genoveva, age 50, lives alone in her own house.  She has been farming for five years.  She mostly plants potatoes, corn, and peas, among other products.  Her children sometimes help her during the planting or harvesting seasons, which require more labor.  She also hires workers.  That allows her to optimize time and sell her harvest at the local market.

It is advantageous for her to farm because it allows her to have food available.  Also, some products are profitable even though she realizes that there is a risk of losing her investment due to climate factors.  However, her years of experience give her the capacity to prepare for the possibilities in order to improve.  That is why she will get ahead in this business activity.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy and motivated to know that she has financial support.  She is grateful to the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very useful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Felix Rafael

texts.es: El Joven Félix Salvador Z. L., tiene la edad de 26 años; es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe (comarca La Borgoña) actualmente soltero, pequeño agricultor desde hace quince años   , los planes hacia un futuro es poder establecer  una granja de porcina para obtener otros ingresos, el joven desde muy pequeño aprendió a trabajar las tierra ya que su papá  eso le enseño para que se apoyara; ya que por medio de su pobreza no le podía dar estudios. En estos momentos el joven cuenta con un cultivo de piña que  presenta una coloración no adecuada del cultivo y las frutas no se están desarrollando normalmente; lo cual necesita aplicar fertilizantes e insumos   para tener una mejor cosecha  y no cuenta con un financiamiento para poder realizar la compra y la aplicación al cultivo .
texts.en: Mr. Felix Salvador Z. L. Jr. is 26 years old, lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe (in the county of La Borgoña) and is currently single. He has been a small farmer for 15 years.  His future plans are to establish a pig farm to diversify his income.  The young man learned to work the land from a very young age. His farther taught him so that he could support himself, since due to their poverty he couldn't go to school.  Right now he has a pineapple crop that hasn't ripened sufficiently and the fruit are not developing normally; therefore he needs to apply fertilizers to improve his harvest, and he doesn't have the money to be able to buy and apply them to the crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene un  hijo.  Ella tiene como grado de instrucción secundaria completa. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, como polleras, enaguas, chompas y mandiles. Trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce años, la primera vez solicito un monto de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, con lo que pudo comprar una docena de chompas para incrementar su mercadería, aparte de la actividad mencionada hace tejidos como mantones y todo a croché.
Con éste crédito de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará polleras y dos docenas de chompas de $ 20.00 dólares, estos productos los trae de Desaguadero para venderlos en la feria de Juliaca  e Ilave
Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa bien surtida en Juliaca.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el trabajo en equipo y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the María Asunción Galindo Communal Bank.  It is located in the Juli district, Chucuito – Juli province, Puno department.  She is 30 years old, married, and has one child.  She has a high school education.

She sells articles of clothing like “polleras” (traditional Bolivian skirts), “enaguas” (traditional underskirts), sweaters, and aprons.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 12 years.  The first time she requested 300 soles, which she used to buy a dozen sweaters to increase her merchandise.  Aside from this business activity, she makes weavings like scarves and crochets everything.

She will use this loan for 1,000 soles to buy polleras and two dozen sweaters for $20.00.  She will take these products to Desaguadero to sell at the Juliaca and Ilave fair.  Her dream is to have a well-stocked clothing store in Juliaca.

What she likes about her communal bank is working as a team and the meetings with the members.

loans.use: To buy skirts and two dozen sweaters

loans.name: Alida Lopez

texts.es:
La Sra. Alida López tiene 41 años de edad y se dedica a la fabricacion de repostería, su especialidad es la elaboración de donas con azúcar, donas con chocolate, relámpagos, picos y pan dulce con la variedad de semitas, marquesotes y bollitos; todo este producto de buen tamaño y de buen gusto.
En su negocio tiene un empleado varon que le distribuye el producto.- 
El lugar en donde elabora sus panes se mantiene con buena higiene.
Doña Alida tiene contratos fijos con sus clientes y toda la produccion solo la distribuye y a fin de mes hace los respectivos cobros.
Doña Alida manifiesta sentirse contenta porque su negocio cada dia va creciendo mas y mas, ya que ella no ha parado de trabajar.
La Sra. Alida López es madre soltera, depende una hija de ella, le cubre todos los gastos y actualmente la tiene estudiando en un colegio de la localidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales al por mayor y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alida López is 41 years old, and she makes pastries.  Her specialties are making doughnuts with sugar, doughnuts with chocolate, “relámpagos” (pastries with cream filling), “picos” (pastry filled with a mixture of sugar and cheese), a variety of sweet breads like “semitas” (layered with marmalade filling), “marquesotes” (pastry made with rice or corn flour, egg, and sugar), and buns.  All of the products are a good size and taste great.

In her business she employs a man to distribute the product.  She maintains good hygiene at the place where she makes her breads.  Alida has steady contracts with her customers, and she distributes all of her production.  She charges at the end of the month.

Alida says that she is happy because her business is growing more and more every day.  She has not stopped working.

Alida López is a single mother with a daughter who is dependent upon her.  She covers all of her expenses, and her daughter is currently attending a local school.

She will use the loan to buy wholesale ingredients to have better income.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, vanilla, eggs, shortening, oil, chocolate, and cream

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marta Etelvina

texts.es:
Marta Etelvina V. R.: es casada de 40 años de edad tiene 3 hijos, ella tiene un salon de belleza el cual inicio hace 4 años ella se dedica a atender todos los dias por las tardes y por las mañanas se dedica a su familia y a la venta de calzado su salon de velleza se llama ethel.
Solicita el credito para la compra de cosmeticos de belleza como uñas,tintes,colorantes,shampoos,etc ella mas adelante desea comprar unas bitrinas mas ya que las que tiene el producto ya no cabe,el sueño mas grande de ella es ver a sus hijos graduados y berlos con un futuro mejor y que sean unas personas de bien el sueño para su negocio, es poder comprar un lotecito para poder tener su salon y no pagar alquiler del mismo
texts.en:
Marta Etelvina V. R. is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a beauty salon, which she started four years ago.  She takes care of her business every afternoon.  In the mornings she devotes her time to her family and to selling footwear.  Her beauty salon is called “Ethel”.

She is requesting the loan to buy cosmetics and beauty products like nails, tints, dyes, and shampoos, etc.  Later she wishes to buy more display cases because the products that she has no longer fit in the case she has.

Her biggest dreams are to see her children graduate, to see them have a better future, and to see them become successful people.  Her dream for her business is to be able to buy a small lot.  Then she would not have to pay rent for her salon.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products like nails, tints, dyes, and shampoos, etc.

loans.name: La Bendicion 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Marta is the coordinator of her group "La Bendicion" 2, 4 & 5 (Blessing). She makes her home here in a simple house with her eight children and her long-time partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise and provide for her family. She plans to continue enjoying being with her children.

Marta is excited to be taking out her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She has had her business for over six years, starting after the first loan she received from Esperanza Internacional. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, shirts, underwear and shoes. She will use the profits to pay for a lot that she acquired.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to start up a business; a group was formed in her community and she was invited. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: new clothing for resale

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 6 hijos (4 a su cargo).  Ella pudo estudiar solo primaria incompleta.
Emiliana tiene un puesto en el mercado Juli donde se dedica a la venta de verduras, y nos cuenta también que hace bordados en telas, donde plasman las costumbres de los  habitantes de la isla URUS, isla que se encuentra ubicado en el lago Titicaca. Viene trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace once años, la primera vez que solicito su préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para comprar tela y lana para hacer lindísimos bordados.
Ahora solicitará nuevo préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizara para comprar verduras como lechuga, cuatro arrobas de zanahoria, dos arrobas de cebolla  y otros para seguir operando con su negocio.  
Su sueño es seguir trabajando con el negocio que tiene. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia generada por sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito - Juli province, in Puno department.  She is 53 years old, married, and has 6 children (4 of whom are in her care).  Emiliana did not finish elementary school.

Emiliana has a stall in Juli market where she sells vegetables.  She tells us that she also embroiders on fabric, capturing the customs of the inhabitants of URUS island, an island that is found in Lake Titicaca.

Emiliana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eleven years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money to buy fabric and yarn for making her beautiful embroideries.  On this occasion, she is requesting 300 Peruvian soles to buy vegetables such as lettuce, four 11kg sacks of carrots, two 11kg sacks of onions and others so that she can continue running her business.

Emiliana's dream is to continue working in her business.  What she likes about her community bank is the interest that she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as lettuce, four 11kg sacks of carrots, two 11kg sacks of onions, etc.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa C., es casada  y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 19 a 32 años, ella se dedica en un lugar del centro de Barranquilla a comercializar accesorios de plata,  entre  aretes, cadenas y tobillera;  como no cuenta con el   capital de trabajo  que requiere su negocio, se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque necesita  acceder a un credikiva para comprar cadenas, aretes, anillos tobilleras,  artículos de gran aceptación que  registran una fuerte demanda en su  mercado.  
Su negocio es de tradición familiar por parte de su esposo,   ella antes vendía  alimentos y refrescos, pero decidió  con su esposo aunar esfuerzos y dedicarse todos dos a la comercialización de joyas de plata, así lograron tener dos negocios al mismo tiempo y muy juntos, donde ella comercializa los accesorios de plata y   su esposo  se dedica a en su propio  taller al mantenimiento y a la reparación de los mismos.
Su trabajo le ha permitido educar a sus hijos y brindarle un techo seguro, pues  con sus dos puntos de ventas, la disciplina y el amor familiar han logrado salir adelante y para ellos ha sido de mucho agrado la idea de compartir el mismo trabajo y agregar  más ingresos familiares a su hogar en comun acuerdo.
texts.en:
Tomasa C. is married and has 5 children aged between 19 and 32.  Her business is located in the center of Barranquilla.  She sells silver jewelry, including earrings, chains and ankle bracelets.  As she does not have the working capital that she needs for her business, she has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to access a Kiva loan which will allow her to buy chains, earrings, rings, ankle bracelets.  These are all very popular products that are in high demand.

Tomasa's business is a family business through her husband.  Tomasa used to sell food and drinks but she decided to join forces with her husband and the two of them would sell silver jewelry.  In this way they managed to have two businesses.  They are a very united couple.  Tomasa sells the silver jewelry and her husband works in his workshop, maintaining and repairing it.

Tomasa's work has allowed her to educate her children and provide them with a safe roof over their heads.  Through her two sales outlets, discipline and family love, they have managed to get ahead in life.  They have enjoyed the idea of sharing work and adding more income to their household by common consent.

loans.use: To buy chains, earrings, rings and ankle bracelets.  These items are very popular and in very high demand.

loans.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Susana de 44 años, es  soltera empezó su negocio desde 11 años con poca  papelería, poco a poco  ha ido incrementando su negocio.  Después de un tiempo compro vitrinas porque  le fue bien ya que está ubicada cerca del colegio  y universidad y ahora vende papelería muchas cosas de bazar y hasta productos varios de primera necesidad.  

Susana abre desde muy temprano su negocio hasta las 22:00pm y atiende sola su negocio. No tiene ninguna dificultad en su negocio.  Con el préstamo va a comprar artículos de bazar, papelería. Unas de sus metas es que desea tener un bazar y papelería más grande e incluir víveres de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Susana is 44 years old and single.  She started her business 11 years ago with very few stationery products.  She gradually expanded her business.  After a while she bought display cases because things were going well as she is located near a school and a university.  Now she sells stationery products, many other miscellaneous items and some essentials.

Susana opens very early in the morning and remains open until 10.00pm.  She works alone and doesn't have any problems in her business.  She will use her loan to buy miscellaneous goods for her store and stationery products.  One of her goals is to own a larger store and to sell basic food products.

loans.use: To buy stationery products

loans.name: Carola

texts.es: Carola tiene 44 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 15 años tiene su tienda de abarrotes, instalada en su misma casa, y en donde sus hijos la apoyan en la atención hacía los clientes, mientras realiza compras de más productos al por mayor para implementar su establecimiento. Siempre mantiene abierto su tienda, de esa manera no deja de vender, además proporciona pan y otros productos que el cliente necesita para el desayuno, ya que una panadería se encuentra muy lejos, así que se levanta muy temprano a conseguir este producto. Por tal razón dese continuar adelante por lo que su deseo es mejorar su tienda abasteciéndola de más productos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para implementar más su tienda, en esta ocasión como esta cerca las fechas de inicio escolar se abastecerán de mercadería en útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Carola is 44 years old and lives with her 3 children in her own home.  She has owned a grocery store, which is located in her home, for more than 15 years.  Her children support her by serving her customers while she goes to buy more products wholesale with which to stock her store.  Carola's store is always open which means she never stops selling.  She also provides her customers with bread and other products that they for their breakfast since the nearest bakery is quite far away.  She gets up very early to acquire these products.  Carola would like to continue to make progress in her business.  She would like to improve her store, stocking it with more products.

This is Carola's first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being a member of her community bank because the members are responsible people and very supportive of each other.  Carola thanks those who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in stocking her store some more.  On this occasion, as the back-to-school season is approaching, she will stock her store with school supplies.

loans.use: To buy more products, including school supplies for the back-to-school season

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Ella estudió solo hasta tercero de secundaria. 
Juntamente con su esposo se dedican a la producción de trucha, productos que son criados en seis jaulas, una vez madurado los vende. Con Movimiento Manuela Ramos viene trabajando hace un año, el primer préstamo que fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la  compra  de dos sacos de alimento  para truchas.
Ella solicitara un préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, para comprar  cinco sacos de alimento balanceado marca tomasino y purina.
 Su sueño es  salir adelante y tener una casa en juliaca. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y las charlas.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito - Juli province, in Puno department.  She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children.  She only studied up to the third year of high school.

Together with her husband, Hilda raises trout in six cages.  Once they have grown she sells them.  Hilda has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in buying two sacks of feed for her trout.

Hilda is requesting a new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy five sacks of Tomasino- and Purina-brand balanced feed.  Her dream is to get ahead in life and to own a house in Juliaca.  What she likes about her community bank are the prompt payments and the chats.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of Tomasino- and Purina-brand balanced feed

loans.name: Elia Alpina

texts.es: Elia  tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Inicio poco a poco ahorro y de esta manera, hoy en día gracias a todo el esfuerzo que realiza diario es que sigue con este negocio. Su fuerza luchadora que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para convertirse en una mujer empresaria. Ahora ha ganando experiencia, confianza y ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. Con este crédito comprará diferentes tipos de productos como leche, carnes, golosinas, avena en paquetes,  utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal. Elia está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día y agradece al Fundación León 2000 por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en: Elia runs her own general store. In the beginning she saved a little at a time and so today, owing to all her daily efforts, she continues to run her business. She has used her fighting spirit, which has always been part of her character, and her will to make ends meet by her own means to turn herself into an entrepreneurial woman. Now she is more experienced, more confident and she is now well known and liked by her customers. She will use this loan to buy different products such as milk, meats, sweets, bags of oats, domestic cleaning utensils and personal hygiene items. Elia is happy with the work that she does each day and is grateful to Fundación León 2000 for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nicaja Group

texts.es: Doña Maria L. V., tiene 32 años D. edad, curso el 2do grado D. educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 D. los cuales estan estudiando, se decica a la venta der ropa, su conyugue es comerciante. Doña Maria organiza un grupo para poder solictar un prestamos que servira para ampliar su capital D. trabajo, empezo su negocio desD. los 22 años D. edad, cuenta con 10 años D. experiencia con est negocio. Las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas como son: Venta D. ropa y crianza D. animales, sueñan con un negocio granD.  para mejorar sus ingresos y sus ganancias, para mejorar su condicion D. vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. María López Velásquez, 32, finished second graD..  She has three children, two of whom are in school.  She sells clothes and her spouse is a merchant.

María organized a group to be able to request loans to increase working capital.  She started her business at the age of 22 and has 10 year experience in it.

The members of the group are in various productive activities like clothing sales and raising animals.  They dream with having large businesses to improve income and profits thus improving their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Gladys Xiomara

texts.es:
Doña Gladis Xiomara tiene 40 años de edad y es la propietaria de la caseta que se encuentra ubicada dentro de la Escuela “MANUEL DE ADALID Y GAMERO” en donde se imparten clases en dos jornadas: matutina y vespertina dicho centro que cuenta con una asistencia de 750 alumnos promedio diarios.
Doña Gladis no tiene competencia dentro de la escuela ya que es la única cafetería que esta dentro de la misma y por seguridad de los alumnos tampoco los dejan salir a comprar afuera de dicha escuela.

Doña Gladis esta casada y junto a su esposo han procreado 3 hijos, que dependen de ellos, su esposo es técnico en salud y trabaja para el Ministerio de Salud Pública como promotor de salud.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar alimentos y refrescos al por mayor para obtener mejores precios y asi tener mas ganancias.
para bajar sus costos ella produce las tortillas de harina para las baleadas, tambien todas las comidas las fabrica ella, lo unico que compra son las donas, reposteria empaquetada y refrescos, en todas las demas comidas compra los materiales y ella las fabrica.
texts.en:
Gladis Xiomara, age 40, is the proprietor of the stall in the Manuel de Adalid y Gamero School.  Classes are taught in two shifts, morning and evening.  The center has an average of 750 students attending daily.

Gladis does not have competition in the school.  Hers is the only snack bar in the school, and for security purposes the students are not allowed to leave to buy food outside of the school.

Gladis is married.  She and her husband have three children who are dependent upon them.  Her husband is a health technician, and he works for the Ministry of Public Health as a health advisor.

She will use the loan to buy food and soft drinks wholesale in order to get better prices and better income.  To lower her costs she makes the flour tortillas for the baleadas [the basic baleada is a thick flour tortilla folded in half containing refried beans and grated queso duro (a hard salty white cheese), and mantequilla (a white sauce much like sour cream].  She also makes all of the meals.  The only things that she buys are the doughnuts, packaged pastries, and soft drinks.  She buys the ingredients and makes all of the other food.

loans.use: To buy flour, beans, cheese, soft drinks, juice, churros, eggs, candy, doughnuts, stuffed pastries, meat, chicken, bread, fresh cheese, sausages, chocolate milk, pastries, and cookies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Ella pudo estudiar la secundaria completa. 
Su actividad consiste en la crianza de pollos, actividad que es compartida por tota la familia y también se dedica a la artesanía, principalmente tejido de mantones y bordados. Está trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace doce años, el primer monto solicitado de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dicho dinero le sirvió para comprar telas y lanas para elaboración del bordado.
Ahora solicitara nuevo monto de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá  para comprar unas 30 docenas de pollitos y su respectivo alimento.
Su sueño es comprarse un lote en la ciudad de Tacna y seguir trabajando con su negocio.Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el trabajo en equipo.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Communal Bank “María Asunción Galindo” which is located in the District of Juli, Province of Chucuito-Juli, Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Isabel was able to complete her high school education.

She raises chickens and engages in this business with the rest of her family. Isabel also makes handicrafts, primarily woven shawls and embroideries. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for twelve years. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 300 PEN, which she used to purchase yarn and wool for making her embroideries.

Now she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN. The money will be invested in the purchase of 30 dozen chicks and poultry feed. Her dreams include buying a plot of land in the city of Tacna and continuing to work in her business. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank is being able to work as a team.

loans.use: Purchase 30 dozen chicks & poultry feed

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: El señor Manuel P. Velásquez, tiene la edad de 39 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , en comarca Buenos Aries , junto a su compañera de vida la cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras para poyarlos con los gastos del hogar ya que tiene tres hijos el mayor de ellos trabaja y le apoya y los otros dos estudian , los planes hacia su familia es poder comprar una moto taxi y  tener mejores beneficio  y brindarle mayor aportación a su familia , don Manuel desde hace diez años labora como agricultor  cultivando piña , la mayor afectación ha sido las plagas , porque carecen de cuidados y fertilizantes necesarios para que los plantillos de piñas estén en buenas condiciones y puedan ser grandes y de un buen sabor . El solicita el apoyo de Afodenic atrávez de Kiva ya que en el primer crédito logro mejor el 50 % delcultivo y ahora quiere mejor la otra parte para tener un mejor resultado en la venta de piña.
texts.en:
Manuel P. Velásquez, age 39, lives in the Ticuantepe municipality in the rural area of Buenos Aries.  He lives with his life partner, who sells fruits and vegetables to be able to help them with the household expenses.  He has three children, the oldest of which works and helps him.  The other two attend school. 

His plan for the family is to be able to buy a “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) and have better profits to contribute to his family.  Manuel has been working as a farmer growing pineapples for ten years.  The biggest hindrance has been the pests.  This is because they lack the needed care and fertilizers for the pineapple plants to be in good condition, to grow big, and to taste good.

He is requesting support from Afodenic through Kiva.  With his first loan he managed to improve 50% of his crops.  Now he wants to improve the other part in order to have better results selling the pineapples.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Juana De Dios

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Qoya, provincia D. Calca, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Juana; La socia tiene 73 años D. edad, la socia  es viuda; la socia trabaja en el mercado D. Coya vendiendo productos D. chuño, papa, moraya, carne y verduras. La socia tiene unos terrenos D. cultivos que al día D. hoy se encargan D. cultivar sus hijos que ya son independientes, ella sigue con su stand en el mercado atendiéndolo diario y abasteciéndolo, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos y aumentar sus ventas.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Juana is 73 years old, a widow and a member of the communal bank "CAPAC QOYA".  The bank is located in the Qoya district in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.  She works in the Coya market selling potatos, chuño and moraya (Peruvian potatoes), meat and vegetables that she grows on a piece of farmland.  She attends to and stocks her stand in the market daily.  She also has children that are now independent.

She is requesting a loan to purchase dried products and increase her sales.  She is happy with the loan granted and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase dried products to increase her sales

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. María Guaman es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive en la comunidad de Amarillo en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Muchos han migrado en busca de trabajo para entregarle un mejor futuro para sus hijos.

La Señora. María tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 31, 29, 22, 13 y 8 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo de 13 años   estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo su propio vehiculo, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de su hogar pero también es negociante de animales como: ganado, gallinas, cerdos, pollos, etc.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más animales. Su meta es crecer  en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. María Guaman is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Porvenir” (New Future). She lives in the community of Amarillo in the parish of Cumbe, an area that experiences cold weather. The people engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture. However, many have migrated in search of work so that they can provide a better future for their children.

Sra. María is 49 years old, married, and has five children (ages 31, 29, 22, 13, and 8). Her three oldest children are married and live independently. Her 13 year old son is in high school while the youngest daughter is in elementary school. María’s husband is a professional driver who operates his own vehicle. This couple was able to build their own home.

Doña María takes care of her children and her home, but she also sells animals such as cows, hens, pigs, chickens, etc. She has been a member of her Communal Bank for 13 years. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of more animals. Her goal is to grow in her business.

loans.use: Purchase more animals

loans.name: Geydi Janeth

texts.es:
Doña Geydi S. tiene 33 años de edad y se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de Donas y golosinas dentro de un centro educativo de la ciudad de Danlí llamado C.E.B “JOSE TRINIDAD REYES” donde se imparten clases en tres jornadas del día, pero ella solo vende en dos jornadas mañana y tarde y en la tercera jornada se dedica a preparar la venta para el día siguiente, nos comentos que en la jornada nocturna las ventas son bien bajas.
Geydi cuenta con 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y es la dueña de la caseta de dicho centro de estudio.
Doña Geydi es madre soltera, tiene 2 niñas, hace más de un año que se separo de su compañero de hogar y es ella la que se ha hecho cargo del hogar y a la crianza de sus dos hijas, las cuales están cursando sus estudios primarios.
La Sra. S. es una mujer de admirar ya que a pesar de su fracaso matrimonial, no le a quitado el deseo de superación y ahora lo hace con mas fuerza por que dice que tiene que sacar adelante sus dos hijas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las donas y de las golosinas.
texts.en:
Geydi S. is 33 years old and her main business activity is selling donuts and sweet treats in an educational center in the city of Danlí called C.E.B. "José Trinidad Reyes".  Classes take place there in three shifts a day but Geydi only sells during two shifts: morning and afternoon.  During the third shift she prepares her sales for the following day.  She tells us that sales are very low during the evening shift.

Geydi has been in this type of business for 4 years and she owns her stand in the educational center.  Geydi is a single mother.  She has two daughters and separated from her partner more than a year ago.  She is now in charge of the household and the raising of her two daughters who are in elementary school.

Mrs S. is a very admirable woman since, in spite of the breakup of her marriage, she hasn't abandoned her desire to improve herself and now she works with even more effort because she says that she has to get her daughters ahead in life.  She will use her loan to buy materials for making her donuts and sweet treats.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, margarine, oil, eggs, baking soda, sugar, vanilla, meat, tortillas, chicken, potatoes, cassavea, bananas, beans, rice, soft drinks, juice, soft cheese and cheese

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 41 years old, single, and has a 9-year-old daughter. She is a member of the communal bank "Nobleza" and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 4 years. She owns an internet cafe in Ayacucho and is also hoping to expand to sell notebooks and pens. Elizabeth bought her computers in 2003 and would like to update the memory and software. She likes that FINCA encourages her to save and would one day like to buy the building she is renting for her store.

loans.use: To upgrade computers and purchase supplies

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Ella pudo estudiar la secundaria pero no la concluyó. 
Hace cuatro años viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su  préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, lo cual consiste en la venta de ropas de vestir como, chompas y pantalones en polar todo para niños. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 600.00 nuevo soles,  comprará tres docenas de pantalones de polar y una docena de chompa.
 Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio  y tener una casa en Ilave.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es lo que gana su ahorro.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito-Juli province, in Puno department.  She is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She studied at high school but didn't finish her studies.

Justina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money to increase her business stock.  Her business is selling clothes such as children's sweaters and fleece pants.  Her husband works as a farmer.

Justina will use this loan for 600 Peruvian soles to buy three dozen pairs of fleece pants and a dozen sweaters.  Her dreams are to improve her home and to own a house in Ilave.  What she most likes about her community bank is the money she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy three dozen pairs of fleece pants and a dozen sweaters

loans.name: Carmen Rosalina

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen P. es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive en la comunidad de la Floresta en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Muchos han migrado en busca de trabajo para entregarle un mejor futuro para sus hijos.

Doña Carmen tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene una niña de 3 años de edad, su esposo labora en la construcción como oficial de albañilería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus padres pero independientes.
 
La Señora. Carmen se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también a la cría animales como: cerdos y cuyes los que vende en su comunidad.
 
Hace 13 años es socia del banco comunal y le gusta porque tiene muy buenas amigas con quienes comparte en cada reunión,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de animales para crecer en este negocio. Su sueño es  tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen P. is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir community bank. She lives in the Floresta community in the parish of Cumbe, where the weather is cold. The people from her community are traders, farmers and animal breeders. Many of them have moved away in search of work so that they can provide their children with a better future.

Señora Carmen is 36 years old, married and has a three-year-old daughter. Her husband works in construction as a master bricklayer. They do not have their own house, so they live at home with their parents, but independently.

Señora Carmen takes care of the household chores and she also raises animals such as pigs and guinea pigs, which she sells in the community.

She has been a member of the community bank for 13 years and she likes it because she has some very good friends who attend the meetings with her. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of animals so that her business can grow. It is her dream to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy pigs and guinea pigs

loans.name: Ligia Celestina

texts.es:
La Señora Ligia C. es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive en la comunidad de San Capac en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Muchos han migrado en busca de mejor trabajo para entregarle un mejor futuro para sus hijos.

Doña Ligia tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 20, 19, 13, 8 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja solo para sus gastos, su segunda hija trabaja y estudia a distancia, su hija de 13 años ayuda en casa y también estudia a distancia, su hijo de 8 años estudia en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como jornalero, con el trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Ligia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos ya que pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos pero también cría  animales como: cerdos, cuyes y pollos  que los vende en su comunidad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 9 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos. Su meta es  crecer en su negocio y que sus hijos se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Ligia C. is a member of the 'Nuevo Porvenir' (New Future) community bank.  She lives in San Capac community, in Cumbe parish.  This area has a cold climate.  Its people work in sales, raising livestock and farming crops.  Many have migrated in search of a better job so that they can provide their children with a better future.

Ligia is 36 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 20, 19, 13, 8 and 5.  Her eldest child (a son) works to cover his expenses, her second child (a daughter) works and is taking a distance-learning course.  Her 13 year-old daughter helps in the house and her 8 year-old son is attending a local elementary school.  Her husband works as a laborer.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

Ligia takes care of her housework as she stays at home looking after her children.  However, she also raises animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens which she sells in her community.  She has been a member of her community bank for 9 years.  She will invest her loan money in buying more chickens.  Her goal is to grow in her business and for her children to do well in life.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad.  Es soltera y estudió la secundaria completa. 
Está empezando trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Ella hace trabajos de artesanía sobre todo lo que es el bordado en tela, además se dedica a la chakra, al igual que muchas mujeres de su localidad, sin embargo no es su actividad principal. Julia necesita  un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, con lo que comprará 20m de tela y diferentes colores de lana para matizar el trabajo.
Su sueño es trabajar y juntar capital propio para realizar otro tipo de actividad y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le impacto por primera vez  del Banco Comunal es lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "María Asunción Galindo” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito-Juli province, in Puno department.  She is 19 years old, single and completed her high school studies.

Julia is just starting to work with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She makes handicrafts, especially embroidery on fabric. Like many women of the area, she also farms, although this is not her principal activity. Julia needs a loan for 500 Peruvian soles to buy 20 meters of fabric and different colored yarn with which she can embellish her work.  Her dream is to work and get together enough money so that she can carry out another type of business activity and improve her income.  What has impressed her about her community bank is the money she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy 20 meters of fabric and different colored yarn with which she can embellish her work

loans.name: Bayardo Marcelo

texts.es: El señor Bayardo Marcelo, tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa que labora como comerciante de frutas, verduras y abarrotes para poder apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar, ya que tienen dos hijos que estudian su primaria y necesitan del apoyo de los dos para poder salir hacia adelantes juntos como familia, don Bayardo labora desde hace  cinco años como albañil en una empresa constructora  ; la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no poder tener un capital suficiente para poder comprar de una solo ves los materiales de construcción para su vivienda , el está muy contento ya que con el primer crédito logro hacer las cuatro pareces de la misma y ahora quiere comprar el zinc , perlines, puertas , ventanas y otros materiales pendiente para la construcción .
texts.en:
Bayardo Marcelo is 45 years old.  He lives with his wife in the Ticuantepe municipality.  She sells fruits, vegetables, and groceries to be able to help him with the household expenses.  They have two children who go to elementary school.  They both need to help to be able to get ahead together as a family.

Bayardo has worked as a bricklayer for a construction business for five years.  The greatest difficulty he faces is not having enough money to buy all off the construction materials for his house in one purchase.

He is very happy because he used his first loan to build the four walls of the house.  He now wants to buy zinc sheets, beams, doors, windows, and other materials that are needed for the construction.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Martha Mariela

texts.es:
Martha de 34 años, es originaria de Pueblo Nuevo municipio  de Estelí, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, estudio secretariado ejecutivo, tiene una mini tienda donde vende ropa y cosméticos la cual  tiene 7 años de funcionar. Comenzó a trabajar en este negocio con ayuda de su  esposo que trabaja como conductor de autobuses públicos. Al principio vendía  mercadería ambulante de casa en casa con el tiempo, hizo un préstamo y logro poner su mini tienda la cual tiene dentro de su propia casa, solamente ha tenido este negocio, la experiencia de saber este negocio la heredo de sus padres quienes han tenido este tipo de negocios y le han enseñado a ella como administrarlo bien. 
El crédito lo solicita para comprar productos nuevos como repuestos de vehículos y hacer mejoras a su vivienda. Este crédito le ayudara a mejorar y acondicionar mejor su negocio y vivienda, para poder ofrecer mejores  productos atraer mas clientes y darles un techo digno donde vivan sus hijos.
Tiene como planes ampliar sus negocio donde también pueda vender zapatos al por mayor, comprar vitrinas para mantenerlas surtida de nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and from Pueblo Nuevo, in the town of Estelí.  She is married and has 3 children.  Martha studied to be a business secretary.  She owns a small store where she sells clothes and cosmetics.  She has owned her business for 7 years.  Martha started working in this business with the help of her husband who works as a bus driver.  At first, she sold her merchandise door to door but she took a loan and managed to set up a small store in her own home.  This is the only business she has owned.  She inherited the experience she needed for this business from her parents who also owned this type of business and they taught her to run it well. 

Martha is requesting this loan to buy new products such as vehicle spare parts and to make some improvements to her home.  This loan will help her to improve and better adapt her home and business so that she can offer better products, attract more customers and provide her children with a decent home in which to live.  Her plans are to expand her business so that she can also sell shoes wholesale, to buy display cases and to keep her store stocked with new products.

loans.use: To buy new products such as vehicle spare parts and to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as sugar, cooking oil, corn and firewood in wholesale.

loans.name: Jaoquin

texts.es:
Joaquín, de 60 años de edad, nació en Rodeo una comarca localizada en Pueblo Nuevo a 13 kilometros del Municipio de Estelí, es casado, tiene 7 hijos, de oficio agricultor en el cual lleva alrededor de 46 años en esta actividad. Inicio a os 12 años de edad a trabajar en la agricultura, ayudando a su padre debido a su pobreza y la necesidad de buscar el alimento no logro estudiar. A los 26 años se independizo y compro una manzana de tierra con el dinero que gano trabajando en el campo.
Actualmente se  dedica a sembrar maíz y frijoles los cuales siembra en invierno y verano, ya que su terreno cuenta con un pozo para riego.
Solicita el crédito para comprar  2 quintales de UREA, 1	quintal de abono completo y pago de mano de obra. El crédito le ayudara a obtener una buena cosecha de maíz.
Dentro de sus planes futuros esta siempre segur cultivando sus tierras, tiene como meta próxima comprar otra manzana de tierra , comprar un par de bueyes para no tener que pagar para preparar la tierra y dejarles un techo digno donde sus hijos puedan  vivir y salir adelante en sus estudios ya que el no pudo.
texts.en:
Joaquin, 60 years old, was born in Rodeo, a community located in Pueblo Nuevo, 13 kilometers from the municipality of Esteli. He is married, the father of 7 children, and he is an agriculturist by trade, an occupation he has had for about 46 years. He started working in agriculture when he was 12 years old, to help his father who was poor and to secure nutrition.  He didn't go to school. When he was 26 years old he became independent and purchased a plot of land with the money he earned working the fields.

Today he cultivates corn and beans, sowing in the winter and the summer because his fields have a source of water. 

He requests a loan to purchase 2 packages of urea, 1 package of complete fertilizer, and to cover labor costs. The loan will help him secure a good corn harvest. 

Among his plans for the future is to keep cultivating the land. His next goal is to purchase another plot of land and to purchase 2 bulls to avoid paying to have the land tilled. His goal is to provide his children with a dignified home for them to live and to support them in their studies, something he was not able to do.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es: La Sra.  Delicia de edad de 46 años oriunda de Santa Cruz de la provincia San  José Andrés Ibáñez  actualmente vive en la zona de San José  hace 30 años, su actividad se dedica a la confección y arreglo de prendas de vestir hace 13 años y como segunda actividad venta de patasca sábado y domingo cuenta con este negocio hace 2 años vende en su domicilio.                                                                                                    Estado civil Convive con el señor Fanor hace  30 años y cuenta con la actividad de sastre hace 15 años en la zona de la 7 calles los señores cuentan con 3 hijos que se e encuentran estudiando en la universidad, con el dinero del crédito comprara telas e hilos para la confección de uniformes escolares ya que tiene un pedido.  La señora se siente agradecida con nuestra entidad financiera por haber confiado en ella nuevamente.
texts.en: Delicia is 46 years old and she is originally from Santa Cruz, of the San Jose Andres Ibanez province. She has lived in the region of San Jose for 30 years. She has a business where she makes clothing and provides alteration services. She has had her business for 2 years and she sells from her home. She has been married common-law with Fanor for 30 years. She has been a seamstress for 15 years in the region of 7 Calles. They have 3 children together and they are all attending university. With the funds from the loan she will purchase fabrics and threads to make school uniforms, an order that has been placed. She is thankful to the financial organization to have imparted their trust on her once again.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tienen 3 hijos que están en edad escolar.  Ella pudo estudiar la secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce años, el primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, con el que compró cinco casacas por el valor de s/.60.00 nuevo soles.
Actualmente tiene dos tipos de actividades principales: producción de truchas y venta de casacas, los productos de este último los compra en desaguadero y los vende en Ilave.
En el negocio de la producción de truchas recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, además su esposo es albañil y trabaja en las construcciones de la zona.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 1200.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos docenas de casacas y el resto lo utilizará para comprar alimento para truchas. 
Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio  y dar educación a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la alegría y las bromas entre las socias.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the communal bank named "Maria Asuncion Galindo", located in the district of Juli in the Chucuito-Juli province in the department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and she has 3 school-aged children. She was able to graduate high school. 

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past twelve years.  The first loan was in the amount of S/300 nuevos soles and she used it to purchase give jackets, valued at S/60 nuevos soles each. She currently has two businesses: trout hatchery and jacket sales. The products of the last business type are purchases in Desaguadero and later resold in Ilave. 

For the trout hatchery business she gets help from her husband and children. Her husband is also a construction worker and he works in construction projects in the region. 

With this loan, amounting to S/1200 nuevos soles, she will purchase two dozen jackets and the remaining funds will be used to purchase feed for her trout.

Her dream is to improve her business and to provide her children with an education. What she most likes about her communal bank is the good humor and jokes played among the members.

loans.use: To purchase 2 dozen jackets and to purchase feed for trout.

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es: La Sra.  Sulma es cliente nueva de la institución ella sola esta sacando  adelante a tres de sus pequeños hijos ya que se esta separando de su esposo ella vive en casa propia tiene su pequeño hijo quien estudia en el colegio de la zona y sus dos hijas mayores estudian derecho en la facultad de derecho Su hija mayor de 19 años es quien le ayuda mas puesto que viaja constantemente  a chile  la Sra.  Sulma es peinadora y su sueño s poner su salón de estética personal y así dejarles con negocio a sus hijos el crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de material para el salón (rasuradora eléctrica e insumos del salón), e s una persona muy trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Sulma is a new client of the organization. She is raising her three young children by herself, having separated from her husband. She lives in a house of her own. Her young son is in school and the two eldest daughters are studying law in the faculty of law. Her eldest daughter is 19 years old and she is the one that helps her the most because she frequently travels to Chile. Sulma is a hairdresser and her dream is to set up her own beauty salon, to leave the business to her children. The loan that she requests is to purchase materials for her salon (electric hair clipper, and salon products). She is a very hard working person and she is thankful to the organization for the support they provide her, by granting her a loan.

loans.use: To purchase salon products and appliances.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna, es una mujer dichosa, pues está contenta de poseer una familia unida, y trabajadora, que lo conforman su esposo Edmar, y su hija Kaori, con quienes vive en su casa propia, ubicada en Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Durante todo el día. Giovanna, se dedica a la venta de tamales, chicharrón, y una variedad de frutas, en un puesto que queda a orillas del puente. Ya tiene 15 años vendiendo en este lugar y; en todo este tiempo pudo adquirir buenos clientes. Diariamente vende un promedio de 30 a 40 tamales, pero según cuenta que en los meses de marzo, abril y mayo, que es la campaña agrícola de café, vende en mayores cantidades, y sus ingresos se duplican. Ahora ella desea ambientar su negocio para poder generar más ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “comerciantes”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde es una socia respetada, por su vitalidad y ganas de salir adelante. Giovanna, con la moto carro (medio de trasporte público) que adquirió; incursionó en el trasporte público, por ello con el crédito comprará piezas para su mantenimiento, asimismo comprará insumos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a woman who is happy because she has a united and hardworking family, made up of her husband Edmar and her daughter Kaori, with whom she lives in their own house in Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian jungle). 

During the day, Giovanna sells tamales, pork cracklings and assorted fruits from a stall beside the bridge. She has been selling in this spot for 15 years, during which time she has acquired good customers. She sells an average of 30 to 40 tamales a day, but during the months of March, April and May, which is the coffee season, she sells many more and her revenue doubles. 

Now she wants to change her business to generate more profit. This is Giovanna's sixth loan with MFP. She belongs to the Comerciantes communal bank, where she is a member who is respected for her vitality and desire to succeed. With the motorbike (means of public transport) she acquired, she has taken her first steps into public transportation. So, she will use this loan to buy parts to maintain the motorbike, and she will also buy supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy parts to maintain her motorbike, plus supplies for the food she prepares

loans.name: Duo Peña De Oro Group

texts.es:
DUO. PEÑA D. ORO.
MARIA ESPERANZA S.. TIENE 34 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE DOS HIJOS Y ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. TORTILLAS, SU CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA PODER COMPRAR 4 TAREAS D. LEÑA PORQUE EN ESTA EPOCA ESTA UN POCO BAJO EL PRECIO D. LA LEÑA Y COMPRA D. MAIZ ES POR ESA RAZON QUE NECESITA SU PRESTAMO.
VIVIAN ISABEL N. L..TIENE 30 AÑOS D. EDAD Y TIENE DOS HIJAS, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. TORTILLAS EN SU COMUNIDAD, PERO TAMBIEN ELLA SE DEDICA A CUIDAR UN BEBE CUANDO DEJA D. TORTIAR, SU CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA COMPRAR 4 TAREAS D. LEÑA Y COMPRA D. MAIZ AHORA QUE ESTA BAJO EL PRECIO D. LA LEÑA.
texts.en:
This is the group "Duo Pena D. Oro." 

Maria Esperanza S. is 34 years old.  She has 2 children and has a business selling tortillas.  She needs a loan to buy corn and 4 loads of firewood, because in this season the price of firewood is low.  

Vivian Isabel N. L. is 30 years old and has 2 daughters.  She has a business selling tortillas in her community.  But she also has a baby in her care when she is not making tortillas.  She needs a loan to buy 4 loads of firewood and to buy corn, because this is the season when the price of firewood is low.

loans.use: to buy corn and to buy firewood at wholesale

loans.name: Yenni

texts.en: Yenni is 32 years old and has a live-in partner and two children at home. She has been selling groceries from her home for the past 10 years. She will be using her loan of 1,500 PEN to purchase supplies for her store, such as rice, sugar, oil and milk. Yenni has been a member of FINCA Peru for 4 years and is a member of the communal bank "Nobleza".

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, milk for grocery store

loans.name: Boussoura  Lô / Samba Ka Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité Boussoura  Lô / SAMBA KA a été crée le 30/12/2009 . Il est composé de 28 femmes qui sont du même village. Elles son unies par des liens d'amitié, de parenté et de fraternité. Leurs activités dominantes sont le petit commerce et l'embouche ovine. 

Madame NDEYE L. (debout à l'extrême sur la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe rose) est la responsable de groupe. Elle âgée de 69 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses trois neveux.

Elle fait de l' embauche comme activité. Elle a commencé à pratiquer cette activité depuis qu'elle a commencé à travailler avec CAURIE-MF en 2009. Son mari l'aide pour la vente des animaux

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter au moins trois moutons qu'elle va engraisser pendant 5 à 6 mois pour les vendre ensuite dans les marchés.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants et de la nourriture pour la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group Boussoura Lô/Samba Ka has been created on December 30, 2009. It is composed of 28 women from the same village. They are joined by friendship, family ties and common work. Their main activities are retail and raising sheep. 

Mrs. Ndeye L. (standing at the far edge of the photo, wrapped in a pink scarf) is the group’s leader. She is 69 years old. She is married and the mother of five. She also has three nephews in her care.

She raises livestock. She has started this line of work since joining Caurie-MF in 2009. Her husband helps her sell the animals.

Her new loan will allow her to purchase at least three sheep to be fattened for 5-6 months for later resale at   a market.

Her goal is to help her husband cover the school fees for her children and the food expenses for the family

loans.use: Purchasing sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Jivia

texts.es: Jivia, es una mujer de 35 años. Como madre soltera cuida con mucho amor de sus 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad. En su casa propia ubicada en Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, se dirige al puesto que tiene a orillas del puente, donde vende desde hace 8 años, tamales, refresco a base de diferentes frutas, y de vez en cuando comida típica del lugar. Según menciona los días sábado y domingos genera una ganancia neta de 100 nuevos soles diarios. Su mayor ambición y deseo es poder mejorar su negocio y por ende obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan solventar los gastos de sus hijos, pues la pensión económica que recibe de parte del que fue su esposo, no le alcanzará para poder  brindar una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “comerciantes”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde es una de las socias más comprometidas, con el desarrollo de su asociación. Jivia, viaja constantemente a las ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Villa Rica y Oxapampa, por ello con el crédito comprará de 30 javas de frutas de todas la variedades, para comercializarlos a los pobladores del lugar.
texts.en: Jivia is a 35 year-old woman.  As a single mother, she cares for her 4 minor children with a lot of love in her own home, located in Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian rainforest.)  For the last 8 years she has gotten up early every morning and gone to a post that she has on the side of the bridge where she sells tamales, drinks made from different fruits, and occasionally, dishes that are typical of the area.  On Saturdays and Sundays she generates net earnings of 100 Peruvian soles a day.  Her main ambition and desire is to be able to improve her business, so that she can have higher earnings that would allow her to cover the expenses of her children, because with the stipend that she receives from her ex-husband she cannot provide them with a good education.  She belongs to the communal bank "Comerciantes," and this is their 5th loan cycle with MFP.  She is one of the members who is most committed to the development of her association.  Jivia travels constantly to the markets that are held in the cities of Villa Rica and Oxapampa.  With this loan she will buy 30 crates of fruits of all varieties, to sell to the residents in her area.

loans.use: to buy 30 crates of fruit

loans.name: Luz Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz C. es socia del banco comunal Azogueñitas, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es hermosa por su estructura colonial y l moderna, también es reconocida por su iglesia catedral que se encuentra en lo mas alto de esta ciudad, su gente es muy cordial y amable.
 
Doña Luz tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian en la escuela, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia trabaja realizando los quehaceres domésticos en diferentes casas y le gusta esta actividad por que no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos.

Se encuentra trabajando con los créditos del banco comunal hace un año y ha llegado ha tener un buen laso de amistad con sus compañeras, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos. Su meta es tener una casa y un negocio en ella como una tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz C. is a member of the communal bank named "Azoguenitas". She lives in the city of Azogues. This city is beautiful for its colonial and modern architecture. It is also well known for the cathedral church that is located on the most elevated part of the city. The people are very polite and kind.

Luz is 29 years old, married, and she has 4 children who are still in school. She doesn't own a house, so they rent their space. 

Our client provides janitorial services in various private homes and she enjoys the business because she doesn't have a fixed schedule to follow. At home she raises chickens and pigs.

She has been working with loans from the communal bank for the past year and she has come to form a great friendship with her colleagues. The funds from her loan will be used to invest in the purchase of pigs. Her goal is to have a house of her own and a business, such as a store.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Qoya, provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Margoth; La socia tiene 46 años de edad, la socia  es soltera; la socia tiene 1 hija de 20 años; la socia trabaja en su propio negocio, la socia tiene una tienda de compra y venta de celulares y todo tipo de accesorios para celulares, ella también tiene un emporio; La socia es una mujer muy competitiva y sin mayor apoyo pudo llevar adelante su empresa y educar a su hija, la socia es una mujer muy fuerte y muy inteligente, ella desea seguir creciendo y poner sus sucursales de venta de celulares a lo largo de los distritos en el valle sagrado y poder dar una adecuada educación a su hija en la universidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de celulares y recargas para dar el servicio a sus clientes y de este modo incrementar sus ventas.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Margoth, 46, is a member of the “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank located in Qoya district, Calca province, Cusco department.

She is single and has a 20 year old daughter.  She works in her own business which is a cell phone and cell phone accessories store.  She also has a market.  She is a very competitive woman who has been able to succeed both in her business and to educate her daughter with no help from anyone.  She is a strong and intelligent woman.

She wants to continue growing and to establish branch cell phone stores throughout the districts in Valle Sagrado to provide her daughter with a quality university education.  She requests the loan to invest in cell phones and cell phone time recharges to provide service to her customers and thus increase sales.

She is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy cell phones and cell phone time recharges.

loans.name: Bertha Maruja

texts.es:
La Señora. Bertha C. es socia del banco comunal Azogueñitas, vive en la comunidad de Zhullin en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es hermosa por su estructura colonial y  moderna, también es reconocida por su iglesia catedral que se encuentra en lo mas alto de esta ciudad, su gente es muy cordial y amable.
 
La Señora. Bertha tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes aun son pequeños y estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Bertha se dedica a la cría de pollos actividad que la realiza en su casa, se levanta muy temprano para alimentar a sus animales y de allí sale a su trabajo ya que realiza los quehaceres domésticos en otras casas.

Se encuentra varios años en el banco comunal y le gustan las charlas de educación que les brindan los promotores en cada reunión. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para creer más en este negocio. Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Bertha C. is a member of the communal bank named "Azoguenitas". She lives in the community of Zhullin in the city of Azogues. This city is beautiful for its colonial and modern architecture and it is also well known for its cathedral church upon the most elevated place in the city. The people are very polite and kind. 

Bertha is 32 years old, married, and she has 4 children who are still young and attend school in the city. By working together they have managed to build a house of their own.

Bertha raises poultry, a business that she runs from her house. She gets up very early to feed the livestock and from there she sets out to work in private homes, providing house cleaning services. 

She has been with the communal bank for many years and she enjoys the educational talks that are presented at each meeting. The funds from her loan will be invested in the purchase of poultry, to expand her business. Her goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Qoya, provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Rossana; La socia tiene 44 años de edad, la socia  la socia tiene 1 hijo, ella es natural de Coya en el distrito de Calca, la socia se dedica al corte y confección de telas ella elabora bellos trajes para damas, caballeros y niños, la socia tiene su pequeña tienda y se encarga de coser los vestidos para toda ocasión y diseña también trajes y abrigos de sus propio diseño. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales tales como telas, hilos de color, agujas para las máquinas y de este modo abastecer su tienda para nuevos pedidos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rossana, 44, is a member of the “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank located in Qoya district, Calca province, Cusco department.

She’s originally from Coya in Calca district and she has a son.  She is a dressmaker; she makes clothes for women, men and children.  She has her small store and she makes clothes for all occasions; she also makes outfits and coats of her own design.  She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like:  fabric, thread in assorted colors and sewing machine needles to stock her store for new orders.

She is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To invest in fabric, thread and sewing machine needles.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casad y tiene seis  hijos.  No pudo concluir sus estudios.
Viene trabajando con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce años, el primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en la compra de artículos de ferretería para su negocio. Ella se dedica a distintas actividades, los mas principales son el bordado y venta de todo tipo de productos de ferretería, con respecto al bordado, elabora pues hermosos paisajes y costumbres de la familia “Urus” para luego venderlos y con respecto a la segunda actividad son comprados los productos desde Tacna y Desaguadero y entregado a los comerciantes en la feria de Ilave.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará  doce cajas de bisagras  y tres docenas de candados. 
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la ganancia generada por los ahorros.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the communal bank named "Maria Asuncion Galindo", located in the district of Juli of the Chucuito-Juli province, in the department of Puno. She is 55 years old, married, and she has six children. She could not complete her studies. 

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past twelve years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/300 and she used the funds to purchase hardware store items for the business. She carries out various activities, but the main ones are cross-stitching and the sale of hardware store items. With respect to the cross-stitching, she creates beautiful sceneries and urus family costumes which she later sells. With respect to her second business she makes her purchases in Tacna and Desaguadero and she resells to the merchants in the fair at Ilave. 

With this loan, amounting to S/500, she will purchase twelve boxes of hinges and three dozen locks. 

What she most enjoys about the communal bank is the earnings generated through savings.

loans.use: To purchase hardware items.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa, de 48 años, es una mujer trabajadora que vive junto a su hijo Jhon, de 18 años. Como madre soltera ella vive junto a su hijo, en su casa propia, ubicada en Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana).
