El Trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer es la venta de comida en un amplio restaurante que tiene a la entrada de puente. Todas las mañanas durante la semana, prepara comida criolla; pero según menciona en el mes de abril, en plena campaña de cosecha de café; prepara comida típica para todos los peones que trabajan en la zona, llegando adquirir una ganancia neta de 100 nuevos soles promedio. Es por eso que dentro de muy poco se trasladará al nuevo restaurante que está construyendo, que es más amplio y con mejores acabados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “comerciantes”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está segura que logrará sus objetivos. Tomasa, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de sacos de arroz, azúcar e insumos necesarios para la venta diaria de comida.
texts.en: Tomasa is 48 years old. She is a hardworking woman who lives with her 18-year old son Jhon. She is a single mother who lives with her son in a house that is her own. It is located in Puente Paucartambo (the central Peruvian jungle). This hardworking woman's business is the sale of prepared foods from a large restaurant located at the entrance of the bridge. Every morning during the week she prepares Creole foods. But during the month of April, during the coffee harvest, she prepares traditional foods for the laborers who work in the region. She manages to earn an average of 100 nuevos soles. This is how she will soon be able to move to the new restaurant she is having built. It is larger and it is improved in the construction. She belongs to the communal bank named "Comerciantes". This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is certain she will achieve her goals. Tomasa will invest the loan she requests in the purchase of sacks of rice, sugar, and other ingredients she needs to prepare foods daily.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Blanca  Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca C. es socia del banco comunal Azogueñitas, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es hermosa por su estructura  colonial y  moderna, también es reconocida por su iglesia catedral que se encuentra en lo mas alto de esta ciudad, su gente es muy cordial y amable.
 
La Señora. Blanca tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene una hija de 13 años de edad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia se dedica a trabajar en un centro de belleza que es de su propiedad, tiene una empleada quien le ayuda en su trabajo, labora de lunes a sábado.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace 4 años y le gusta por que los préstamos son rápidos, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tintes, una secadora de cabello y más productos para su gabinete.
 
Su meta es tener un local propio en donde trabajar ya que donde trabaja es arrendado.
texts.en:
Blanca C. is a member of the communal bank named "Azoguenitas". She lives in the city of Azogues. This city is beautiful for its colonial and modern architecture and it is also well known for its cathedral church located on the most elevated location in the city. The people are very polity and kind. 

Blanca is 37 years old, married, and she has a 13-year old daughter. She doesn't have a house of her own so she rents a space. 

Our client works in a beauty parlor that is her own. She has one employee who helps her with the work. She works from Monday to Saturday.

She has been a member of her communal bank for the past 4 years and she appreciates the fast loans. The funds from her loan will be invested in the purchase of hair dyes, a hair dryer, and other products for her inventory. 

Her goal is to have a space of her own from where to have her business. The space she has now is rented.

loans.use: To purchase hair dyes, a hair dryer and other supplies for her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cheese & cream

loans.name: Angoritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGORITAS” iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal D. Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza D. la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la señora Daysi.   L. negocios que las integrantes D. la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: elaboración D. paquetes con vajilla para regalo, confección D. prendas, Kiosco  D. Salchipapas, venta D. ropa Americana, venta D. edredones, venta D. verduras, costura D. ropa para mascota.
 
La señora Daysi, presidenta D. la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte D. la A.C. “Angoritas”  3 cicL., aproximadamente  año y medio,  el mismo tiempo que tiene el negocio D. venta D. hamburguesas y salchipapas.  La señora Daysi antes no tenía negocio, con su primer crédito pudo comprar lo indispensable para iniciar el negocio, como ser: pan, papa, aceite, salchichas, carne, bolsitas.  El crédito D. este ciclo es para comprar L. insumos por mayor  y D. ésta manera  ahorrar, pues cuando las señoras compran por mayor, el peso es completo y el costo es menor. 
Las ventas se realizan en el Kiosco que le prestó su tía, L. días jueves, sábado y domingo.
Esta forma D. trabajo le da tiempo para atender a sus cinco hijos, desafío que lleva adelante sola, debido a que su esposo falleció.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta D. Pro Mujer, ella responD. que le gustó el hecho D. que le dieran la oportunidad D. recibir crédito con la garantía solidaria ya que no contaba con otra garantía.  También, dijo que el trato D. la asesora era bueno, pues ella le animaba a seguir adelante.
En la reunión se encontraba la mamá D. una D. las socias (la señora que está tejiendo en primera fila), por eso son nueve en la foto.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Angoritas” is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. The group consists of eight members. This Communal Association is led by its Board of Directors. At the head of the Board is the President, Sra. Daysi. The members of the Communal Association engage in various businesses so that they can get ahead. These incluD. making dinnerware to use as gifts, sewing garments, selling sausages and potatoes from a kiosk, selling American brands of clothing, selling quilts, selling vegetables, and making clothing for pets.

Sra. Daysi, the President of the Communal Association, said that she has been a member of “Angoritas” for approximately a year and a half and has participated in three loan cycles. During this time, she has managed a business selling hamburgers and “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes). Sra. Daysi did not have a business before. She used her first loan to buy supplies she needed to start her business such as bread, potatoes, oil, sausages, meat, and paper sacks. The loan for this cycle will be used to buy supplies in bulk, thus allowing her to save some money. Whenever the ladies purchase in bulk, the unit cost per item is less.

Daysi conducts her sales from a kiosk she borrowed from her aunt. Her business is open on Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. By working to this schedule, she is able to take care of her five children. Her greatest challenge is leaving them alone since her husband is deceased.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Daysi said she enjoys the opportunity to receive a loan with a group guarantee since she currently has no other type of guarantee. In addition, she has been treated well by the staff and is excited about continuing ahead.

The photo shows nine adults because the mother of one of the members (the woman in the front row who is knitting) was present at this meeting.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, oil, bread, sausages, paper sacks, and condiments

loans.name: Helmer

texts.es: Helmer, es un joven trabajador que vive junto a su esposa Elizabeth, en casa de su mamá, ubicada en Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Hace 3 años que se independizó y el puesto que adquirió a orillas del puente, le sirvieron para instalar una tienda de venta de pollo, donde vende un promedio de 14 a 15 pollos diarios; paralelo a este trabajo se dedica a la construcción de casas como albañil; realizando así jornadas de trabajo de acuerdo al tiempo que dura la construcción de las mismas. Pero su esposa Elizabeth también le ayuda con la venta de tamales, los días domingos, donde hay más afluencia de visitantes, ya que en el Puente Paucartambo da pasó a tres ciudades. Ahora él desea comprar su propia casa y de esa manera consolidar su familia.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “comerciantes”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde es uno de los socios activos de su asociación. Helmer, se está preparando para la campaña agrícola de café, ya que en esa temporada se duplican sus ventas de pollo; por ello con el crédito comprará una gran cantidad de pollos de corral.
texts.en:
Helmer is a hardworking young man. He lives with his wife Elizabeth at his mother’s house located in Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian jungle). Three years ago, he became independent and acquired a vending stall at the edge of a bridge. There he opened a shop where he sells an average of 14 to 15 chickens each day. In addition to his business, he builds houses as a mason. He works on construction projects based on when his services are required. His wife also helps by selling tamales on Sundays because there are more visitors since the Paucartambo Bridge leads to three cities. Now he wants to buy a house of his own so that his family will be strengthened.

Helmer belongs to the Communal Bank “Comerciantes” (Merchants) and is receiving his third loan from MFP. He is one of the active members of his group. Helmer is preparing for the coffee season because his chicken sales double during this time. For this reason, he will purchase a large quantity of farm-raised chickens.

loans.use: Purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase women's dresses, shorts, shirts, and denim skirts

loans.name: Lorena Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Lorena, Tiene 27 años de edad,  está  casada y de  esta bonita relación procreó 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores  están estudiando en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, trabajan desde la madrugada hasta la tarde, ella vende en su casa ya que tiene un pequeño puesto y su esposo recorre la ciudad de Manta en un triciclo los martes jueves y viernes, ella dice que antes acompañaba a su esposo en sus recorridos pero ahora que sus hijos están en la escuela no puede porque tiene que ayudarlos y cuidarlos, los productos los compran en Portoviejo, porque allá se consiguen más baratos y de mejor calidad.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas, legumbres y verduras. Este es su sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Sus sueños son terminar su casa y poner una tienda.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in the parish of La Sequita, which is part of Montecristi in the prosperous canton of Manabita. The residents are dedicated hardworking people who are proud of their roots. In the parish of La Sequita, the people are honest and know only how to work and take care of their families.

It is here one can find Sra. Lorena. She is 27 years old, married, and her loving relationship resulted in three children (ages 9, 7, and 3). Her two older children are studying in school. Lorena’s husband works as a merchant.

She and her husband have a business selling fruits and legumes. They work from dawn until the afternoon hours. Lorena sells products from a small stand at her house while her husband travels the streets in the city of Manta by tricycle on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays. She says that she accompanies her husband on his trips. However, she is not able when her children are in school because she must help and take care of them. Lorena buys her products in Portoviejo because they are cheaper and of better quality.

She will use this loan to buy fruits, legumes, and vegetables. This is her sixth loan with the Communal Bank and she likes the fact that the interest rates are much lower than other credit institutions. Her dreams include finishing her house and opening a store.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, & legumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make repairs to her hostel

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 53 años; es una mujer trabajadora que enviudó hace 20 años. Sola cuidó de sus 2 hijos, y sus 3 nietos en su casa propia ubicada en el Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Sus trabajadoras manos y su exquisita sazón producen los ricos tamales que vende a los comerciantes de que salen todas las mañanas en las orillas del puente. Diariamente vende un promedio de 300 tamales. En los 30 años que viene dedicándose a este negocio, adquirió buenos clientes, e incluso los pobladores de la ciudad viajan en las festividades que se realiza durante el año para comprar los ricos tamales que prepara Maribel. Pero como ella posee terrenos agrícolas donde siembra plátanos; está pensando sembrar conjuntamente maíz, y de esa manera minimizar los costos de harina para la elaboración de tamales. Ya compró una máquina de moler y con esto está segura que podrá obtener mayores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “comerciantes”, y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde es una de las pioneras que fundó su asociación. Maribel, constantemente compra insumos para la preparación de sus tamales; por ello con el crédito comprará semillas de maíz para esparcirlos en sus cultivos y así minimizar costos, ya que comprando maíz gasta más dinero.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 53, is a hardworking woman who has been widowed for twenty years. She has taken care of her two children and her three grandchildren from her own home in Puente Paucartambo (which is in the central Peruvian jungle). Her hardworking hands produce the exquisite taste of the rich tamales she sells at the edge of a bridge that merchants must cross every morning. She sells an average of 300 tamales each day. Maribel has been in this business for thirty years and acquired good customers, which include residents of the city. They travel to the festivals held throughout the year just to buy the rich tamales that Maribel prepares. In addition, she owns farmland on which she grows bananas. She plans to grow corn as well so that she can minimize the cost of cornmeal used for making tamales. Maribel has already purchased a milling machine to help her secure better earnings.

She belongs to the Communal Bank “Comerciantes” (Merchants) and is taking her eighth loan from MFP. Maribel is one of the pioneers who founded her group. She is always buying supplies for preparing her tamales, so she will use the loan to buy seeds for planting corn. This will minimize her costs since she currently spends a great deal of money when buying corn.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rosewood, sandpaper, polishing paste, and saw blades

loans.name: Carmen Aurora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, ella tiene  65 años de edad, está casada y  fruto de  esta relación tiene once hijos todos mayores e independientes, la mayoría viven en otras ciudades solo dos de ellos viven en la localidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene una tienda en la que vende dulces y caramelos de todas las formas y sabores, además de helados y sodas, trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 16h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que su negocio lo tiene en su casa, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo y a veces también va hasta Guayaquil a comprar mayor variedad de sus caramelos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio para comprar caramelos, helados, sodas entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita parish which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí which is filled with hard working, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and devote themselves to their families.

We met Carmen, 65, here.  She’s married and had 11 children, all of whom are independent adults.  Most live in other cities; only two still live in this location.  Her husband is a farmer.

She has a store selling all kinds of candy and sweets in a variety of shapes and flavors; she also sells ice cream and soft drinks.  She works daily from 9am until 4pm and sometimes even later since the business is located in her home.  She buys all her products in downtown Portoviejo and sometimes goes as far as Guayaquil in order to get a wider variety of candies.

She will use this loan to better stock her store buying candy, ice cream and soft drinks, among other things.

She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because she’s made many friendships in the group.  Her goal is to stay in business and enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy ice cream, candy, sweets, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Par Cisse Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de PAR CISSE est créé le 04 décembre 2007 (jour de son inauguration). Il est composé de 23 membres qui sont du même village et se fréquentent depuis plus d'une décennie. Avant même leur adhésion à CAURIE-MF elles avaient initié des activités génératrices de revenus, des tontines et tant d'autres activités qui ne faisaient que renforcer la cohésion au sein du groupe. 

Madame NGONE SAER S. (debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo, enroulée avec une écharpe rose) est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge d'un neveu 

Elle fait de l'embouche est activité principale et parallèlement elle fait du petit commerce de fruits et légumes. Elle va au marché de la ville la plus proche pour y acheter la marchandise et revendre dans son village. 

Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes et subvenir aux besoins de la famille tout en soutenant son mari dans les taches courantes de la maison
texts.en:
The Par Cisse  Banc Villageois was created on December 4, 2007 (the day it was inaugurated). Its 23 members are all from the same village and have been friends for more than ten years. Even before joining CAURIE-MF, they had started revenue-producing activities. such as savings groups ("tontines") and many other activities that only made the group stronger.
Mrs. Ngone Saer S. (standing on the far right of the photo, in a pink wrap) is the group's leader. She is 40 years old, married, and  the mother of 7 children. She is also responsible for a nephew. Her main business activity is fattening livestock but she also sells fruits and vegetables. She buys produce at the market in the nearest town and re-sells in her village. Her goal is to strengthen her savings and meet her family's needs as well as helping her husband in household tasks.

loans.use: To buy sheep, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mira Clementina

texts.es:
Mira es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad a la agricultura, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de tres años y cuenta con muy buena acogida, gracias  a la buena atención que brinda. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Mira es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Mira, 32, is a mother living with her family in Olmos district, a rural zone whose main activity is farming, located in Lambayeque province over two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small, home-based grocery store.  She offers for sale to her neighbors and customers in the area a variety of daily use items consisting of  first need items and groceries.  She’s been in business for three years and is well received thanks to the good customer service she provides.  These activities allow her to help her husband support the family.

The growing demand her store has been experiencing has led her to think of expanding it acquiring more products.  She has, therefore, deemed it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

Mira is quite a hard working woman and of very good character.  People who know her hold her in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Maranatha De Panamericana Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal de “Maranatha de Panamericana”, está iniciando su primer ciclo en el centro focal de Panamericana. Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Lourdes, como tesorera a la señora Salustiana y como secretaria de actas a la señora Vicky.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos:   venta de comida, pensión, costura de chamarras, repartición de víveres, venta de artefactos, tejido a máquina, venta de ropa nueva, servicio de llamadas telefónicas de tienda, venta de verduras.
La señora Lourdes,  presidenta de la Asociación Comunal de “Maranatha de Panamericana” es una mujer joven con  experiencia en el trabajo de asociaciones comunales, ella comenta que estuvo durante ocho ciclos en el  Centro Focal de Los Andes.   Desde hace un año y medio  la señora Lourdes tiene como negocio la venta de comida,  antes vendía ropa.   Ella vende comida cerca del  Mercado el Carmen en una pensión que alquiló para aquello, ahora con el crédito que está solicitando piensa comprar una máquina para elaborar pollo a la Broster, el saldo servirá para comprar papa por carga y refresco por mayor.   Por ahora recibe el  apoyo de su mamá para atender la pensión, pues tiene que dividir su tiempo entre el negocio y la familia.
texts.en:
The “Maranatha de Panamericana” communal bank is starting its first cycle in the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 8 members.  The governing body has Lourdes as President, Salustiana as treasurer and Vicky as Recording Secretary.  The women’s businesses are varied.  Among them are: food sales, eatery, jacket manufacturing, grocery sales, crafts sales, machine knitting, new clothing sales, store-based telephone call services and vegetable sales.

Lourdes, President of “Maranatha de Panamericana” communal bank is a young woman with experience working in communal associations.  She comments that she was in the Los Andes Focal Center for 8 cycles. 

For the last year and a half she’s been selling food; she used to sell clothes.  She sells food near the El Carmen Market in an eatery she leased for that purpose.  With the loan she’s requesting now she wants to buy a machine to make Broaster-style chicken; she’ll use whatever’s left over to buy a load of potatoes and soft drinks at wholesale.  For now, her mother helps her tend to the eatery because she has to divide her time between the business and her family.

loans.use: To buy a fryer to make Broaster-style chicken and for a load of potatoes.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica C. is from the village of Deboloc Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Jessica is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns & operates a specialized store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste, in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jessica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jessica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda L. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old and is married. To make a living, Nilda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia D. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Artemia is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Artemia owns & operates a business raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Artemia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Artemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Artemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Artemia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Artemia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío CP-10 del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y porcino, el cría su ganado en un terreno propio donde Tomas a adecuado los corrales para su ganado es por ello que cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años que gracias a los ingresos que percibe le permite mantener a su familia.

El desea adquirir alimento balanceado para su ganado ya que la demanda está aumentando. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Tomás es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Tomas is a 34 year-old father who lives with his wife and their 3 children in the rural CP-10 settlement in the Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area located in the Piura region, M. than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Tomas raises and sells sheep and pigs.  He raises his livestock on his own land, where he has set up corrals for his animals.  When they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the merchants who often visit the area where he lives.  He has been raising livestock for 4 years, and he is able to support his family with the income that he earns from this business.

He wants to buy some balanced feed for his livestock, since the demand for them is increasing.  To do this he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Tomas is a person who is very dedicated to his family and is always watching out for their welfare and development.  The people who know him are very fond of him and hold him in high esteem.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his livestock

loans.name: Takku Liggueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGG.  existe depuis qu’il a reçu son premier financement  le30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de femmes qui du même village. Elles sont unies par des liens de de  parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Leurs activités génératrices génératrices  de revenus consiste a faire du petit commerce, de la transformation de l'huile d’arachide, de la vente de parfum, de la couture, de l’embouche, et de l’élevage de volaille. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Village de NDIARE D..

Madame NOGAYE D. debout tout à fait à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est Mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux de ses petits enfants

Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers tels : des chaussures, des vêtements pour enfants, des légumes, du poivre, du piment, de l’ail etc.

Son nouveau crédit lui donnera la possibilité de développer et faire la promotion de son activité de petit commerce

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d’épargne, de prendre en charge le payement de la scolarité d’un de ses petit fils. Et enfin  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille
texts.en:
The TAKKU LIGG.  solidarity group has been in existence since receiving its first loan on December 30, 2009. The group is made up of women from the same village, who have come together as family members, friends and neighbors. Their revenue-producing activities consist of small-scale retail, making peanut oil, selling perfume, sewing, fattening livestock, and raising poultry. The group is part of the NDIARE D. Banc Villageois.

Mrs. Nogaye D., standing at the far right of the photo, is the group's leader. She is married and the mother of 10 children. She is also responsible for 2 of her grandchildren. She sells various items: shoes, clothes for children, vegetables, ground pepper, peppers, garlic, etc. This new loan will allow her to develop and promote her small retail business. Her goal is to increase her level of savings and to take responsibility for paying school fees for one of her grandsons. Finally, she would like to support her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

loans.use: To develop and promote revenue-producing activity

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad  tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su hijos y su esposo en el caserío Malingas  del distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella tiene una Bar Picantería donD. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas como cerveza y chicha D. jora, además ofrece piqueos y comida. Su negocio tiene una antigüedad D. 5 años aquí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona los días sabados, domingos y lunes. El negocio tiene gran acogida gracias a la buena sazón D. Natividad, esta actividad es D. mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio D. el se encarga D. ayudar al sostenimiento D. su economía familiar.

Natividad desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. su comida y también productos  como cerveza y algunas sillas esto debido a que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Natividad is 46 years old, married, and lives with her children and her husband in the rural Malingas settlement in the TambogranD. district.  This is an agricultural area located in the Piura region, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Natividad has a bar/restaurant where she sells drinks such as beer and chicha D. jora (a traditional Peruvian corn-based beverage), and where she also offers snacks and food.  She has had this business for 5 years, and she sells her products to her neighbors and to the people who come to work in the area on Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays. This business is well received by the public, thanks to the good cooking of Natividad.  This business is a great help to her family, because through it she is able to help support her household.

Natividad wants to expand her business by buying supplies that she needs for food that she prepares, and also products such as beer and new chairs, since the demand for her business is growing.  To do this, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles, which will allow her to achieve this objective.

loans.use: to buy supplies and beer for her business

texts.en: Naransaruulzaya, 32, is divorced and lives with her parents, younger brother and her child in Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her parents are retired and her brother attends a local secondary school. Naransaruulzaya makes and sells traditional clothing in cooperation with her mother. Her mother worked as a tailor before she retired. She grew up watching her mother sew clothes and it helped her a lot to become a seamstress and gave her experience to begin her business. They have regular customers and mostly make traditional clothing to order. They want to expand their business and operate a bigger workshop, so that they can take in more work. Naransaruulzaya is a hardworking person who says, "I want to expand my business and have a workshop with 4 or 5 employees." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a couple of new sewing machines and more material for the business.

texts.en:

To make a living, Leoncio owns and operates a specialized retail store. His main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Leoncio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Leoncio joined GDMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Leoncio is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Leoncio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to supplement his family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Ganzorig, 38, is single and lives with his retired father in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house which they built last year. In 2003 he began as a driver in his private taxi business. In 2006 he bought a mini truck to do transportation work in the city. His business is stable and profitable. He plans to buy a larger truck in the future. Ganzorig is an honest and modest person who says "I am working hard to make more profit and to buy a bigger truck.".He is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to build a garage for his car which is important for his business operation.

loans.name: Sarma

texts.en:
Sarma is a married woman who lives in Rizal, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Batsoy, who is 55 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 16 and 35 years old. Sarma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sarma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 24,000 to buy additional stocks for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Sarma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Byambasuren, 49, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed, her older daughter attends college, and her younger daughter attends a local secondary school.  Byambasuren has a degree in nursing, but she operates a rented stall at a local market and sells stationery and used clothing. She pays 130,000 MNT for the rent each month. Her current working capital is 3,000,000 MNT and her daily average net income is 60,000 MNT. Byambasuren is a hardworking person who says, " I want to increase my working capital and buy land where we could build a house". She is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase more goods for her business and to increase her working capital.

He is a modest, neat, hardworking, optimistic person who says, " I want to expand my business and upgrade my current car". He is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase more food for his store.

texts.en: Munh-Amar, 39, is widowed and lives with her daughter in Selenge province of Mongolia. Her daughter attends a local secondary school. Munh-Amar's husband passed away two years ago and her daughter helps her with everything that she can. Munh-Amar used to work as a tailor between 1992 and 1995 and worked for a pharmacy between 2002 and 2003 . Then she worked as a salesperson for her sister's stationery store between 2003 and 2004 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Then she moved to her current place to live close to her siblings. She started to sell clothes in 2005 and has been operating her business for about six years. Now she operates two stalls and pays 45,000 MNT for monthly rent. She is one of our regular bank customers.  She is a hardworking and honest person.  She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more clothing in order to increase her working capital.

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase animal rawhide for her business.

loans.name: Lerma

Lerma, a married woman from the town of Surallah, plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to her community. She also planted coconut trees on a part of her land and now makes copra out of the coconuts, which she also sells to her community. Lerma works hard to help improve her family's living conditions.

Lerma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace C. is from the village of Buguac, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 21 years old. Grace is single and has an infant. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing upholstery services, like repairing sofas and sala (living room) sets to local community members. She also buys and sells firewood and bananas. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide upholstery services. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Mamlekat

texts.en:
Bai Tushum and partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Mamlekat T. obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. 

Mamlekat T. is a 53-year-old widow. She was born into a family of farmers and from early childhood had to help on her parents’ farm. Mamlekat got married at the age of 20 and gave a birth to two sons. She moved to her husband’s home in Stepnoe village, where they lived with his elderly parents. Her husband worked on a large state farm where Mamlekat worked as a dairymaid. He helped her in all her activities. Later, they were able to buy a small house in Kara-Balta town (near the village). The couple worked hard to support their children. But in 1987, Mamlekat lost her support when her husband died of an incurable disease.

After that, Mamlekat became the sole breadwinner for her family. Mamlekat, being a courageous woman, remained firm in her wish to provide a good future for her children. Her salary did not cover all her family’s expenses, so she decided to start her own business. In 1999, Mamlekat sold her house in the town and bought a dairy yard near her Stepnoe village. When she began, Mamlekat had only a few calves. Later, her livestock grew and she obtained milk cows and was able to sell dairy products for a small profit. Mamlekat, thanks to her first Kiva loan, has been able to increase her number of cattle and today has thirteen milk cows and fourteen bull-calves. 

Mamlekat is requesting a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase more bull calves and further develop her business. She also plans to help her elder son buy a flat in Kara-Balta town. 


About Bai Tushum and partners:

Bai Tushum and partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. Bai Tushum and partners is one of the leading Microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

Gloria is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  food vending (barbeque pork/chicken) and farming.  She lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,600. Priscilla is borrowing PHP 18,500 to continue to fund the operations of her business.  This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Priscilla aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,400, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy stocks for the general store so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

texts.en: Estrelita P. is from the village of Maligaya Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 60 years old. Estrelita is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Estrelita is married and has an adult child. To make a living, Estrelita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Estrelita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Estrelita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Estrelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with two small children. He has several greenhouses where he grows vegetables for sale. Sergei has been in this business for 11 years. He grows tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, cabbage, etc. Making sure that they mature early in spring provides a good income to Sergei’s family.

Sergei is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnas to purchase farming supplies for this season, like seeds and fertilizers. He also needs to purchase some film to repair his greenhouses and to buy wood for heating. Sergei enjoys his business and would like to develop it further by building new greenhouses next year.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, a livestock business and a farming business .Her husband John, who is 41 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 6 and 10 years old. Beverly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Beverly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 16,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to buy more stock of goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education and house renovation. Beverly is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more products for resale

loans.name: Edne

texts.en:
Edne L. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old. Edne is single and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Edne owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks & rice per kilogram in the local community. Edne has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Edne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edne is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like breads & canned goods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Edne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine O. is 26 years old and lives in Usenge. She is married to George and they have four children.

Irine has a cereals business that she has been running for the past three years. Her monthly income from the business is Kes 20,000. Irine has a good credit history, and she is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD.   She intends to use the loan to buy beans, maize, rice and green grams to add to her stock. Her business has really improved ever since she started taking the loans.

Her desire is to own a big cereal store. Irine also hopes to buy a piece of land where she can build a family home in the future.

loans.use: Buy beans, maize, green grams to add to her stock.

texts.ar: محمد في عمر 26 سنة اعزب يعمل في محل لبيع الخبز والمناقيش له في عمله 7 سنوات يحب عمله وهو مصدر عيشه يريد التجدد والتطور في عمله وزيادة مدخوله يعاني من منافسة عملية فهو يريد ان يطور عمله وان يزيد من مدخوله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى انشاء فرع جديد لمصلحته + تقوية المصلحة بشراء بضائع جديدة يتميز بالنظافة والدقة في العمل وهو مقصد لزبائنه من محيطه وجيرانه واقاربه

He wants to rejuvenate and develop his business and increase his income. He faces a lot of competition in his business and with the loan he wants to establish a new branch. He also wants to improve his prospects by buying new stock. He is a clean person and pays attention to detail. His customers range from people in his local area, his neighbors and his relatives.

loans.use: To establish a new branch to his bakery and purchase new supplies

She wants to provide for their education and improve their social and financial situation. With this loan she wants to purchase new clothes for the spring season in order to increase her income. She is ambitious and enthusiastic.

texts.en:
Ashot G. is married and lives with his family of eight members, including his eldest son’s family with three little children, in Goris city.  

Ashot started beekeeping 20 years ago with only a few dozen beehives. Through the years Ashot and his sons worked hard and with great patience to enlarge the business and produce quality honey.
 
The grandfather wants to ensure that his family, particularly the grandchildren, have sufficient income to meet their basic needs and receive good educations. To ensure that, Ashot requires a business expansion through purchasing more beehives and thus increasing the family income.

loans.use: To purchase more beehives

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en:
Rapheal is 41 years old, married and the father of five children living in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. 

He longs to educate his children to attain a degree as a minimum level of education. 

For 11 years he has been running a carpentry workshop. He started it from money that he saved while working at the diocese.

He faces a challenge from clients who default on their payments. 

He hopes in the future to move to a bigger workshop with a showroom. 

Rapheal needs the loan to buy timber.

loans.use: To purchase timber for carpentry

loans.name: Hanzel

texts.en:
Hanzel V. is from the village of Laligan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. He is 26 years old. Hanzel is single. 

To make a living, Hanzel plants and harvests rice for sale and runs a retail store. Hanzel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hanzel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Hanzel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Hanzel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Hanzel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 25 سنة اعزب يعمل في محل لبيع الالعاب والادوات المنزلية كريستال وغيره يحب عمله وله فيه نحو 5 سنوات يحب عمله ويسعى الى تطويره بشكل دائم طموح ويحب ان يؤمن مستقبل جيد له ولعائلته التي تدعمه دائما يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة البضائع في محله حيث انه يبيع الالعاب والخرضوات والأدوات المنزلية يتميز عمله بالانفراد في قريته حيث له زبائن من جيرانه ومحيطه
texts.en: Hussein is 25 years old and unmarried. He works in a shop selling toys, household appliances, crystal ware and other such items. He loves his work and has been doing it for 5 years. He is ambitious about its development. He wants to secure a good future for himself and his family, who are always supportive of him. With this loan he wants to buy more inventory for his shop where he sells toys, household appliances and groceries. His is the only such shop in his village and he has customers from his neighbors and those around him.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for his shop

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is 58 years old and married with 10 children. His spouse is a business woman. He has two other dependents and lives in a family of 14 people in Hioma, Uganda.

His family goal is to educate his children. 

For four years he has been operating a retail shop that he started from money that he saved from farming. 

Benon needs the loan to purchase a grinding machine for grains.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo I. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Charo is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Charo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste. Charo has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Charo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Charo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Charo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Charo from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben D. is from the town of Banga. He is 54 years old, married and has a 21-year-old child. To make a living, Ruben owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ruben wants to improve his family's living conditions.
Ruben joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruben has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and a food vending business.  Her husband Gaspar, who is 50 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 9 and 22 years old. Rosita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,400 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to purchase more goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and to have a tricycle for transportation. Rosita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Boniface Kimeu

texts.en:
Boniface Kimeu M. has been in motorcycle transport for two years now and gets a monthly profit of KES 10,000 and his other sources of income are through farming. He is married to Joyce who is also a business lady, and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer, and this is his first loan from KADET LTD and he intends to use the entire loan amount to buy a another motor bike. With the additional income, he will save and provide the basic needs for the family.

He desires to grow his business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy another motor bike

loans.name: Winerma

texts.en:
Winerma T. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old, married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Winerma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, detergents and toothpaste in the local community. Winerma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Winerma joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and junk foods

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 46 سن متزوج وله 6 اولاد يعمل في تصنيع وبيع الحلويات له في عمله 30 سنة يحب عمله كثيرا فهو يتقنه جيدا له خبرة واسعة في عمله يحب عائلته ويسعى الى تزويدهم بجميع احتياجاتهم يريد للعائلة ولنفسه التطور والتجدد يحب ان يزيد من مدخوله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية لصناعة الحلويات وتطوير المصلحة
texts.en: Ali is 46 years old and married with six children. He works by making and selling sweets and has 30 years of extensive experience in this. He loves his work very much and does it with excellence.  He loves his family and wants to provide all that they want for them. He wants to develop himself and his family and increase his income. With this loan he wants to purchase ingredients to make more sweets and develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his confectionery business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his family and his goal is to complete his house, which is currently incomplete. He is a motorcycle rider and has been in the transport sector for the last two years. With the income generated from his business he has been able to build a house. His business dream is to own at least three motorcycles. Charles is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old, widowed and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, breads, junk foods, biscuits and toothpaste in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Lydia joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and junk foods

loans.name: Hermelita

texts.en:
Hermelita L. is from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old, married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Hermelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, spices, detergents and toothpaste in the local community. Hermelita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Hermelita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as breads and beverages. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as breads and beverages

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.ar: محمد في عمر 22 سنة يعمل في مولد لأشتراك الكهرباء له في عمله 2 سنتين اعزب ويريد تأسيس عائلة يحب عمله ويطوره دائما يحلم بالوصول الى اكبر عدد من المشتركين في شبكة المولد الكهربائي خاصته يطمح بأن يصبح صاحب اكبر عدد من المولدات الكهربائية والتجارة بها فهو طموح جدا يتميز بالصدق والدقة في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تطوير وتجديد المولد الكهربائي حتى يتمكن من استقبال عدد اكبر من المشتركين
texts.en: Mouhamad is 22 and works for an electricity provider. He has two years of experience. He is yet unmarried and aspires to have his own family. He loves his work and is constantly developing it. He dreams of recruiting more customers to his company. He particularly aspires to owning a large  number of electricity generators, and wants to profit from their trade, as he is very ambitious. He is known for his honesty and for the accuracy of his work. With the loan he hopes to develop and renovate his generators in order to be able to increase capacity for more customers.

loans.use: Develop and renovate generators

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a natural juice drinks selling business for the past six years, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a clothes selling business which is another source of income. Francisca faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her businesses and maintain her customers in the future.

With the 80,000 KES she wants to purchase a refrigerator, fruits for making juice and Kikoi’s (traditional cotton waist/shoulder wraps) to sell. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge, fruits for making juice and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita O. is from the village of Zone 7, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Warlita is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Warlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

texts.en:
Corazon A. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old. Corazon is separated from her spouse and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, snack foods, canned goods, detergents and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and biscuits. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Lilia Joy

texts.en:
Lilia Joy G. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Lilia Joy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she sells clothing, bags, cosmetics and shoe products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lilia Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar: حسن في عمر 33 سنة يعمل في اعادة تجديد السيارات (حداد) له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله متزوج يعمل بجد ونشاط دائم التجدد والتطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كمية جديدة من الحديد لإعادة تصنيعه واستخدامه في العمل يريد ان يطور عمله فهو يتميز بالدقة والنشاط في العمل وهو يبدع في إعادة تجديد السيارات
texts.en: Hassan is 33, married, and works in the refurbishment of cars as an iron smith. He has been doing this for 10 years and loves his work very much. He is always enthusiastic about developing his business. With this loan he wants to purchase a new batch of iron to use in his work. He is well regarded for his attention to detail and enthusiasm. He is innovative and skilful in car refurbishment.

loans.use: Purchase a new batch of iron

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen P. lives in Gyumri city, which is still recovering from the long time effects of the 1988 earthquake. Armen is married. Both he and his wife are school teachers. To improve their living conditions they opened a grocery shop, which should give them additional income. To keep up with the clients’ demands and the competition, Armen needs to stock up regularly on necessary items, for which he has applied for the loan.

loans.use: To buy necessary stock for his grocery store

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino L. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. He is 60 years old. Marcelino is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as snack foods, canned goods, and fish paste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marcelino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and canned goods. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.
